He needs his harvest to have a high yield and bring in more income.  He's hoping for his family to have better living conditions.  He'll use profits from the loan to buy food for his family and a calf to fatten up.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops in order to yield a better harvest so he'll have more income for himself and his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and supplies (such as material, threads, trimming, and buttons) in bulk.

loans.name: Umutkan

texts.ru: Умуткан 59 лет, замужем. У Умуткан - средне-специальное образование, работает медсестрой в областной больнице. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Умуткан занимается животноводством, стартовав 3 года назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Умуткан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Умуткан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Умуткан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en: Umutkan is 59 years old and married.  Umutkan has a specialized-secondary education and works as a nurse at the regional hospital.  To generate supplemental income for her family, Umutkan raises livestock, which she started three years ago with the purchase of cattle for 3,000 KGS.  Thanks to Umutkan's hard work, she now has one milking cow and five sheep, in her household.  Her monthly income is 20,000 KGS.  With the goal of expanding her business, Umutkan turned to the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase additional sheep.  Part of the profit from her business, Umutkan is planning to re-invest by purchasing additional livestock, and save the rest to pay for her son's wedding celebration.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Bebelu

texts.es:
Bebelu tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en la zona rural de Oyotun , donde su población se dedica al comercio y agricultura, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella es conocida en el medio por la labor de elaboración y venta de pan, Bebelu con la ayuda de su hijo mayor, los ofrece por las calles de Oyotun , transportándolos en una canasta que ayuda a mantenerlos calientes.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de insumos para su negocio, que le permitirá ofrecer variedad de panes captando nuevos clientes y de esta manera genrandole ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Bebelu is 38 and lives with her two children in the rural region of Oyotun, where the populace earn their living in business and agriculture.  It's located two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Perú.  

Bebelu is known for making and selling bread.  With the help of her eldest child, she sells her goods on the streets of Oyotun, transporting them in a basket to keep them hot.  

She has requested a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of supplies for her business.  This will allow her to offer a variety of breads so she can win new customers and generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery.

loans.name: Ma-Watta

texts.en:
Ma-Watta lives in Sinkor; she is 34 years old, single and has three children between the ages of 11 and 9 who live at home and are in school. 

For four years now, she has been selling red oil, dried coconut, okra, pepper, etc. She started this business from her savings; she makes lots of profit and has more customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, dried coconut, okra, pepper, etc. for her business. 

Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, dried coconut, okra, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su menor hijo en Cayalti una comunidad que se caracteriza por el comercio de animales menores y la agricultura de arroz, maíz, caña de azúcar; a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan crianza y venta de animales menores, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, Magadalena ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de patos, cuyes y chivos para posteriormente ofrecerlos en las comunidades aledañas a donde vive a un mejor precio, generándoles mayores utilidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 39 and lives with her husband and youngest child in Cayalti, a community known for trading young animals, and growing rice, corn, and sugarcane.  Cayalti is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Perú.  

Magdalena's is a closely knit family that does their utmost in their work raising and selling young animals.  Their business is located in back of their house.  Magdalena has requested a loan of 3000 soles to buy ducks, guinea pigs, and young goats to sell later on for a better price in the surrounding communities, generating more profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy ducks, guinea pigs, and young goats.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 28 years old, a female, and married. She has four children, ages 7, 5, 4 and 2 who she supports.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer; she has an electronics shop. She has been in this business for five years, and it is located at Mbuyu wa Kusema. In her business, she earns a monthly income of ksh.3,760. 

She is taking her third loan of ksh.30,000, which she intends to use to add stock to her business by buying electronics materials and tools to use in her work. Amina will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her previous loan of ksh.40,000 was paid back successfully.  

Her hopes and dreams for her future business and her children are to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy electronic materials and tools to use in her work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks and energy drinks.

loans.name: Famatta

texts.en:
Famatta lives in Montserrado county, the capital city of Liberia.  It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 31 years old, and a single college student with a four-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. 

For the past six years, she has been selling fashion blouses, jeans, t-shirts, etc. in the community market. She started this business with help from her mother, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She spends eight hours each day on her business, and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table. She called herself a business-minded woman; she likes her business because it gives her more profit.

She is requesting a loan to buy more fashion blouses, jeans, t-shirts, etc. to expand her sales.

She want to get more money to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy more fashion blouses, jeans, t-shirts, etc. to expand her sales.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael de 36 años, estudio hasta bachillerato, es viudo, él se desempeña como policía, sus 2 hijos de 17 y 13 años respectivamente,  están estudiando en el bachillerato y en la escuela.
 
Él no tiene ningún negocio, solo presta sus servicios como policía, desde hace 5 años, siempre le gusto y soñó con ser policía. Él viaja en bus urbano, para su trabajo a veces se queda fuera de casa porque tiene que trasladarse muy lejos.

El préstamo lo utilizara, para la compra de lámina y pintura para que su casa tenga una mejor condición. Sus planes, son que  su casa tenga una mejor condición para que él y sus hijos vivan más cómodos y en una mejor condición.
texts.en:
Rafael is 36 years old and is a widower. He finished his secondary school studies. He works as a policeman. His two children are 17 and 13 years old. The first one is studying in secondary school, the second is in primary school. He has no business, only his work as a policeman which he has done for the past 5 years. He always wanted to be a policeman and enjoys it. He travels by city buses and sometimes he stays away from his house as his work takes him far away. 

Rafael will use the loan to buy sheeting and paint to improve the condition of his house. His plane is to improve the condition of his house so that he and his children live more comfortably and in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and paint to improve the condition of his house.

loans.name: Elías Antonio

texts.es:
Elías es un joven de 22 años, estudio hasta 8°grado, es acompañado, su pareja se dedica a trabajar es empleada, vende zapatos en el mercado, su hija tiene un año y vive con él. También con ellos vive el papá y la mamá de Elías. 

Él se ha dedicado a la agricultura, desde que tiene 11 años, lo aprendió por medio de su hermano y su padre, ya que su padre se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda la vida, además se dedica a la ganadería, su trabajo queda a una hora de camino y se va a pie.

El préstamo se invertirá en la remodelación de su casa, mejorara su condición de vida,  ya que su hogar será remodelado y podrá vivir más cómodo con su familia.

Su deseo, es que su casa este en buenas condiciones y que su familia y él vivan más confortables.
texts.en:
Elías is a 22-year-old young man. He studied up to the 8th grade and is in a committed relationship. His partner makes a living by working as a domestic worker and selling shoes in the market. His daughter is a year old and lives with him. Elías' father and mother live with them too.

He has made a living from agriculture since he was 11 years old. He learned this from his brother and from his father, as his father has made a living from agriculture his entire life. He also makes a living by raising cattle. He works an hour away from his home and travels there on foot.

The loan will be invested in remodeling his house. It will improve his quality of life, as his home will be remodeled and he will be able to live more comfortably with his family.

His wish is that his house be in good condition and that he and his family live more comfortably.

loans.use: to remodel his house

loans.name: Santa Rita

texts.es:
Santa Rita tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotun donde su población se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, arroz, yuca y comercio de animales menores, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo que se encuentra en la región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace doce años, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio y ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para mejorar la infraestructura donde se encuentran sus animales y la compra de alimentos balanceados para posteriormente ofrecerlos a mejor precio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Santa Rita is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in the district of Oyotun. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.  The people here work in agriculture growing corn, rice, yucca and raise small animals.

Santa Rita  has raised and sold small animals for the past 12 years. Her business is located behind her house. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PEN to improve the infrastructure where she keeps the animals. She also wants to buy balanced feed so that later she can get a better price for them, generating more revenues for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and improve the infrastructure of her pens.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in Boyani, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.

Moses is married and has seven children. His wife is currently retired and engages in projects on their land. Him and his wife are currently tending to a tree plantation on their land, which will be an excellent source of forage for their bee colonies. 

This is Moses' first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his beehives to buy a pair of eyeglasses, which he very much needs. In the future, he hopes to expand his tree plantation and make it a viable business.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 43 years old, female, and married. She has five children -14, 8, 7, 5 and 3 years old respectively whom she supports. Loice was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET officer, and she runs a grocery business, which has lasted for four years now and it is located at Mjanaheri. 

In her business, she earns a monthly income of KES 6,000. She is taking her second loan of KES 10,000, which she intends to use in adding a stock to her business, such as tomatoes, potatoes, and cabbages. 

Loice will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to educate her children and have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, and cabbages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
José de 39 años, estudio hasta 6°grado,es acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  han procreado 2 hijos, de los cuales uno está estudiando, su hija tiene dos años. 

Él se ha dedicado a la albañilería, desde que tenía 13 años lo aprendió por medio de su hermano  y  su papa, también se dedica a engordar cerdos para posteriormente venderlos. Su trabajo, se encuentra a una hora de camino y lo hace por medio de su automóvil, con él trabaja su hermano y su hijo de él. 

El préstamo será invertido,  en la compra de cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos, mejorara su condición de vida, ya que engordara y venderá cerdos a un mejor precio.

Espera, que los cerdos se desarrollen bien y que su negocio crezca más,  las ganancias las utilizara en su familia, en su alimentación, también tiene pensado comprar una novilla.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old and is married. His wife works as a domestic. They have two children, one is studying and the other, a daughter, is two years old. José studied up to 6th Grade. He works as a bricklayer which he started at the age of 13 working with his brother and father. He also raises pigs which he later sells. His work is one hour away by road and he gets there in his car. He works with his brother and his nephew.

José will invest the loan in buying pigs to fatten them and later selling them. This will improve his quality of living as he will sell them at a higher price. He hopes that the pigs will grow well and that his business expands. He will use the revenues for his family, for their food. He is also thinking of buying a heifer.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and then sell.

loans.name: Eddy Javier

texts.es:
Eddy javier tiene 28 años de edad vive junto a sus padres en la zona rural de La Matanza un distrito que se caracteriza por el comercio de ganado vacuno y la agricultura de maíz y yuca en Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Javier se dedica desde hace cinco años a la siembra y comercio de maíz, también realiza servicio de mototaxi, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en compra de abono para su cultivo de maíz y de esta manera tener una mejor cosecha que le generara mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Eddy Javier is 28 years old. He lives with his parents in the rural district of Matanza in Morropon, part of the region of Piura on the north coast of Peru. The area the is characterized by it's cattle business and growing of corn and yucca.

For the past 5 years Javier has grown and sold corn. He also offers a motorbike taxi service. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3,000 PEN. He will invest it in the purchase of fertilizer for his corn crops. In this way he can enjoy a better harvest which will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn crop.

loans.name: Aloysius

texts.en: Aloysius is 58 years old. He has 6 children, and 3 are school going children. He basically does animal farming, and firewood trading for side source of income. He chose that business because of his love for animals and for commercial support. He will use the loan to buy a new goat breed from South Africa. His customers are butchers. He is hard working and honest.

loans.use: to buy new goat breeds.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana Elizabeth tiene 40 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad, vive en la zona rural de Oyotun, donde su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y agricultura a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia unidad que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan venta y crianza y de animales de corral, en su domicilio, además trabaja para el programa de CUNA MAS, programa social impulsado por el Gobierno Central, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de animales pequeños y posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Ana Elizabeth is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children who are still minors. They live in the rural area of Oyotun, two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The people there work in agriculture and raise small animals.

They work as a family unit raising and sellingf barnyard animals at their home. Ana Elizabeth also works for CUNA MAS, a social program instigated by the Central Government.

Ana Elizabeth has requested a loan of 3,000 PEN to invest it in the purchase of small animals to fatten them and later sell at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy small animals.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia lives at Sinkor in Montserrado county, the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 44 years old, and married with 7 children between the ages of 6 and 22 who are attending school and living at home. 

For the past two years now, she has been running a shop where she sells soap, rice, soft drinks, oil, and others items. She started this business with the help from her husband, and learned this way of selling from him. 

She likes her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more soap, rice, soft drinks, oil, and other items for her business. She want to get more money to build her house since she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more soap, rice, soft drinks, oil, and others items for her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Fatmata from Tombo in the rural western area of Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children between the ages of 6 and 20. Three of her children are currently attending school. During the war, Fatmata established her business selling home products. She began her business because she wanted a source of income to support her household. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that the purchasing power of customers is very low sometimes.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is in her late thirties and married with 4 children between 2 and 10 years old. She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since 2000, and sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits in her community. She says that the main problem in her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Aminata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standards of living. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos en una zona rural de Pucará, donde su población se dedica a la siembra de café, cacao, arroz, piñas, papayas, comercio de los mismo y ganado vacuno, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Hace cuatro años Mario se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi, haciendo ruta en el distrito de Pucará y caseríos, El ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de un repuesto para su vehículo y con ello seguir trabajando para generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is 33 years old and lives alongside his wife and two children, in a rural area in Pucará.  Here the people make a living growing coffee, rice, pineapple, and papayas, and selling these fruits.  They also work raising cattle.  Pucará is two hours from the city of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern highlands.

Four years ago Mario started working offering public transport services in his rickshaw.  He works on the roads in the Pucará and neighbouring districts.  Mario is applying for a loan of 500 Nuevo Soles to buy spare parts for the rickshaw, so that he can continue working and earning an income for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Ebelyn Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ebelyn es un joven de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco a lado de su madre a quien quiere mucho y a la cual apoya con el fruto de su trabajo como empleada en una farmacia de su ciudad, Ebelyn logro estudiar la carrera de enfermería técnica, es por ello que logro obtener este empleo. Ebelyn trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y amable con los clientes de la farmacia.
Ebelyn esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando ella podrá comprar ventanas, puertas y materiales para poder terminar de construir la vivienda de su madre, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Especializarse en pediatría y tener su consultorio”.
texts.en:
Ebelyn is 21 years old and lives in the city of Pisco.  She lives with her mother, whom she loves very much and whom she supports through her work as an employee at one of the city's pharmacies. Ebelyn was able to study nursing and this is how she found her job in the pharmacy.  Ebelyn works some ten hours every day and thinks the work is going well because she is very responsible and friendly with the customers.

Ebelyn is grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help they are providing, she will be able to buy windows, doors, and building materials in order to finish building her mother's house.  With the house, Ebelyn can improve her mother's quality of life and Ebelyn can continue to fight to make her dream, of specialising in paediatrics and having her own surgery, a reality.

loans.use: to buy windows, doors, and building materials.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Emma from Tombo in rural western Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 7 and 12 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2009, Emma established her home products business. She began her business because she wanted to get a source of income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes the purchasing power of the customers is very slow.

Emma requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers and plates for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Emma plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers and plates for resale

loans.name: Mayiteh

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Mayiteh from Tombo western rural in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 1 and 8 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. After the war, Mayiteh established her home product business. She began her business because she wanted to get a source of income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that, sometimes, purchasing power of customer is very low.

Mayiteh requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standards of living. In the future, Mayiteh plans to have a fishing boat. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Emma from Tombo, a western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of two and twelve years old. After the war, Emma established her retail business. She began her business because she needs to create income to survive. She works at the business 10 hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Emma requires a loan in order to buy a carton of sardines and rubber bowls for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business. In the future, Emma plans to own a big general store shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a carton of sardines and rubber bowls for resale.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Salamatu from Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children between the ages of three and six years old. One of her children is currently attending school. After the war, Salamatu established her home product business. She began her business because she wants to earn a source of income to support her home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is spending time moving around the community to introduce her vendor business.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Salamatu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables and wood

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Zainab from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 6 and 10 years old. After the rebel war, Zainab established her cake business. She began her business because she wanted to strive for her daily living. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run it.

Zainab requires a loan in order to buy flour, sugar, and cooking oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Zainab plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is in her late twenties and is married with two children between four and six years old. She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since she left school and sells soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits to her community. She says that the main problem in her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Patricia requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarette s, and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Zainab from Tombo, a western rural area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of two and eight years old. Zainab established her palm oil business after her wedding. She began her business because she wants to strive for her survival. She works at the business 10 hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Zainab requires a loan in order to buy palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her level of living. In the future, Zainab plans to expand business more and more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María de 36 años,  debido a la condición económica de su familia, no le pudieron dar el estudio, ya que era una familia bastante numerosa y de escasos recursos económicos y siendo la mayor tenia que ayudar a su madre y a su padre en las actividades de la casa. Luego, se acompaño y procrearon dos hijos, tiempo después su compañero de vida la abandono con sus dos hijos; ellos están estudiando, uno esta cursando un 4º grado y el otro 8º grado cerca de la comunidad.

ella vive con sus dos hijos y tiene que trabajar por su cuenta, se dedica a trabajar la agricultura cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y también en la crianza de ganado bovino y animales de granja pollos de engorde, también se dedica a comprar ropa y otros artículos para venderlos de casa en casa, todo esto lo hace para  mantener a sus hijos. 

La actividad agrícola se lo enseño su padre, ya que ella le ayudaba a trabajar cuando él cultivaba;  también, cuidaba animales que eran de su padre y los animales de granja que tenían en su casa. La actividad de venta de ropa, lo aprendió hace algunos años debido a pocos ingresos mensuales, ya que las anteriores actividades esta obteniendo los ingresos hasta que saquen la cosecha. En los cultivos lo realiza cerca de su casa y tiene que estar pendiente de estos, ya que tiene que pagar mosos y también trabajan con ellos, en la crianza de pollos tiene que estar pendiente todo el día, ya que tiene que estarlos alimentando para que puedan desarrollarse, y en la venta va a los lugares mas cercanos, para vender en casa en casa si es posible todo el día, esta actividad la realiza cuando no trabaja en la agricultura.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, para la compra animales de granja pollos(200) y la comida necesaria para el desarrollo de los mismos y en la compra de ropa para su posterior venta, ya que se acercan las épocas navideñas y hay una mejor venta.

Espera para el futuro, comprar su propia vivienda, ya que sus hijos van creciendo y quiere darle una vivienda propia y también espera sacar adelante a sus hijos, si es posible hasta estudios superiores y espera para el próximo año comprar mas pollos para aumentar los ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old and, due to financial reasons, she was not able to study at school.  The family is large and they had little money.  As the eldest, María had to help her mother and father in the home.  Later on, María married and had two children.  However, her partner left her with their two children.  They are now in school - one is in fourth grade, the other in eighth. The school is near their community.

María lives with her two children and has to work alone.  She makes a living in agriculture, growing corn on 7000 square metres of land.  María also raises cattle and farm animals, such as chickens.  In addition María buys clothes and other items to sell from door-to-door.  She does all this work so as to support her children.

It was María's father who taught her to work in farming, as she used to help him with his crops.  She also looked after her father's animals and the farm animals that he had at home. María learned about selling clothes a few years ago as she had a very small monthly income.  This low income is due to the fact that the crops do not make any money until harvests María's crops are located near her home and they must be looked after.  She also pays young labourers to work with the crops.

María must also look after the chickens all day as they need to be feed in order for them to develop well.  María goes out to sell in nearby places and sells from door-to-door all day long if possible.  She sells clothes when she is not doing farming work.

This loan will be used to buy 200 chickens, and the necessary feed for them to develop properly.  María will also buy clothes to sell as Christmas is approaching and she will make more sales at this time.

In the future, María hopes to buy her own house as her children are growing up and she wants to give them their own house.  She also hopes to prosper with her children, and, if possible, wants them to go into tertiary education. María hopes to buy more chickens next year, in order to increase the family's income.

loans.use: to buy 200 chickens, and the necessary feed for them to develop properly.  María will also buy clothes to sell as Christmas is approaching and she will make more sales at this time.

loans.name: Bassama Ii Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Bassama II” group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Isata is the featured leader of this group. The 30-year-old is married to a driver, and they have three children. Isata has been a businesswoman for nine years now; she sells dried fish.  With her share of this loan, she will buy baskets of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy baskets of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la comunidad de Pucará donde su población se dedica a la agricultura de café, cacao, arroz y comercio de frutales, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Son una familia unida, Benjamín realiza labores agrícolas de arado, con sus yuntas (2 toros) y un yugo, para preparar el terreno para los sembríos, también se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 400 nuevos para invertir en la compra de un toro para seguir realizando su trabajo, debido a que uno de ellos es más pequeño y no hay igualdad en trabajo y de esta manera seguir percibiendo ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Benjamín, age 43, lives with his wife and two children in the Pucará community.  The population there devotes itself to farming coffee, cacao, and rice and to selling fruit.  The community is two hours from the city of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

They are a united family.  Benjamín does his agricultural work of plowing with his two bulls and a yoke.  He does this in order to prepare the land for his plants.  He also raises and sells cattle.

He has requested a loan for 1,400 nuevo soles to buy a bull in order to continue doing his work.  This is because one of them is smaller, and there is an unevenness in his work.  This way he will continue getting income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en una zona rural de Nueva Arica a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia emprendedora que se esfuerza por tener una mejor calidad de vida, Martin se dedica a las labores agrícolas como jornalero y su esposa junto a sus hijos apoyan en la atención de la pequeña bodega que tienen, además se dedican a la crianza y venta de aves de corral en la parte posterior de su vivienda.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para invertir en mercadería para su bodeguita y la compra de animales pequeños para su posterior engorde y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Martin, age 53, lives with his wife in Nueva Arica, a rural zone that is one hour from the city of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

They are an enterprising family that puts forth great effort in order to have a better quality of life.  Martin does farm work as a day worker.  His wife, together with their children, helps run the small store that they have.  They also raise and sell poultry in the area behind their house.

He has requested a loan for 3,000 nuevo soles to buy merchandise for their little store and to buy small animals.  He will later fatten the animals and sell them for a better price, which will generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for their little store and to buy small animals.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Marie from Tombo western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 2 and 17 years.  She started her business after her mother died. 

Marie established her palm oil business because she was trained in business and she needs to generate income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Marie requires a loan in order to buy palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Marie plans to expand her business more and then even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 28 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County.  She and her fiancé are living together, and they have two children, who live at home and attend school.  Unfortunately Tina's parents did not send her to school, but she is good at managing her business. Her fiancé is a constructor who build houses. 

For the past three years Tina has been selling cosmetics in the local market.  She says she now faces no problems.  She spends six days a week from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. on her business.  She started this business with a little money she received from her fiancé.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. She hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 40 years old and married, with four children between the ages of 5 and 15 years. 

She runs a palm oil business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to improve her condition of living. 

She's been in this business since just after she got married, and she sells palm oil within her community. She says that at present her business is doing well because out of the profit, she is able to take of her family.

Marie requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil for resale. She says the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a fish business in Tombo western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to generate income to support the home. 

She has been in this business since just after she got married and sells fish within her community. She says that at present, she is faced with insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mabinty requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 30 years old and married with two children, ages 2 years and 8 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo, Western rural area, in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. 

She's been in this business since just after she got married; she sells fish within her community. She says that at present, her business is doing well because out of the profit, she was able to take care of her family.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location.

 In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To produce organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 30 years old and married, with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 13 years.  She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone.  She began her business to strive for a better living.

She’s been in this business since getting married and sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits within her community.  She says that the main problem with her business is a lack of capital to expand.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. 

In the future she would like to open a big provision shop.  She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Gladis Mercedes

texts.es: Gladis Mercedes 30 años de edad madre soltera de un pequeño hijo aun bajo su responsabilidad originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega zona que se caracteriza por poseer uno de los ingenios mas grande del país, al igual predomina el comercio, desde muy temprana edad comienza con su negocio que es la venta de ropa usada, zapatos, chores, vestidos entre otros los cuales vende por encargos cuenta con clientes fijos y eventuales sus ventas son al contado y al crédito con recuperación quincenal y semanal, negocio el cual lo tiene establecido en su casa de habitación pero en ocasiones también sale de forma ambulante en diferentes repartos de su municipio, uno de sus sueños es poder ver a su hijo convertido en un profesional y que su negocio prospera mas, tambien el de mejorar su casa de habitación y así ofrecerle un techo digo donde vivir a su pequeño hijo.el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en pacas ya que manifiesta que en estos tiempos su ventas incrementan debido a la apertura de zafra del ingenio.
texts.en: Gladis Mercedes is 30 years old. She is a single mother of a young son whom she is still raising. She is from one of the municipalities of the Chinandega area which is distinguished by having one of the biggest sugar factories in the country. Commerce is also predominant and she started her business when she was very young, selling used clothes, shoes, shorts, dresses and more. She sells to order and has regular and occasional customers. She charges up front and sells on credit, collecting every two weeks or every week. She has her business in her house and at times goes out as a street vendor in different parts of her town. One of her dreams is to be able to see her son become a professional and for her business to prosper more, as well as improve her home and give her son a worthy place to live. The purpose of this loan is to invest in packs of clothing, because she says that at this time her sales increase due to the beginning of the cutting of the cane for the sugar factory.

loans.use: to buy packs of used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stocks of African print cloth

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 45 years old and married with 3 children between 18 and 28 years old.  She runs a palm oil business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone.  She started this business to improve her and her family's life. 

She's been in this business since just after she was married and sells palm oil within her community.  She says that at present her business is doing well because of the profit she was able to take out for her family.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil for resale.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and educate her children.  In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level.  She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a farmer, aged thirty-six years. She has done farming since 2000, and she says it has rewarded her. She mainly grows tomatoes, which she takes and sells in the markets at a profit. She works five days per week and gives the business an average of five hours per day. 

In addition to farming, she also makes and sells locally made cookies, which gives her more income. Her business is located in a rural area in Bushenyi District. Edith started this business with a motive of supporting her husband. 

She would like to buy chemicals to apply on the tomato garden so that she can harvest much. 

Her clients are mainly the local people in Kiyanga. She has hopes of successfully paying tuition for all her children. Her challenge is the perishability of what she deals in, since she sometimes has losses. She also has bad debtors who never pay on time, but she hopes that the challenges will be overcome.

loans.use: to buy organic chemicals for her tomato garden.

loans.name: Posseh

texts.en:
Posseh is 35 years old and married with two children, ages 4 years and 10 years. 

She runs a shoe business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. 

She's been in this business since just after she got married, and she sells shoes within her community. She says that at present her business is doing well because out of the profit she is able to take of her family.

Posseh requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more shoes for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a thirty-eight-year-old single mother of four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Thirteen years ago, she decided to venture into cassava flour selling after assessing the high demand for food in the area. 

Price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes affect her sales, while her dream is to set up a food store that deals in a variety of food items, such as millet and maize among others. 

Dorothy intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Mirian Dianet

texts.es:
Mirian Dianet tiene 27 años de edad vive junto a sus padres en el caserío El Limon una zona rural del Distrito de Callalluc, donde su población se dedican al cultivo de caña de azúcar y café; a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en pequeñas cantidades y productos de belleza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para proveer su negocio de más productos tales como verduras y víveres, menestras y de esta manera generarle mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
27 year old Mirian Dianet lives with her parents in the village of El Limon in a rural area of the district of Callalluc where the people grown sugar cane and coffee. It is 2 hours north of the city of Cutervo, which is located in the Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Perú. 
She works selling groceries in small quantities and beauty products. She has requested a loan of $750 to stock her store with more products such as vegetables, groceries, and beans and, in this way, to generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stocks of grocery provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more maize for making "kenkey"

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su hijo en la zona rural de Pucará qeu pertence a la ciudad de Jaén, donde su población se dedicada al comercio en general, esta ciudad es de un clima caluroso, ubicado en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El es chofer de auto probox en la Empresa San Martin de Tours – Pucara, trasladando pasajeros de Pucara- Jaén y viceversa, José ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para cambiar su brevete y poder seguir trabajando y así seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José is 57 years old. He lives with his wife and his son in a rural zone of Pucará in the city of Jaén, where the populace makes a living in general trades. This city has a hot climate, and is located in the Cajamarca region, a mountain range in the northern part of Peru.

He is a Probox car driver for the San Martin de Tours-Pucara company, transporting passengers from Pucara to Jaén, and vice-versa. José has requested a loan of 500 Nuevos Soles to change his driver’s license and to be able to continue working, and so continue generating an income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a change in driver's license.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory level of pots and pans for resale.

loans.name: Rocio Denisse

texts.es:
Rocio Denisse, tiene 26 años actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Obstetricia en la universidad, su carrera consta de 5 años y ya se encuentra en el último año. 
Ella trabaja de Obstetra en diferentes Postas y hospitales. haciendo sus prácticas pre-profesionales, se dedica cinco horas para realizar sus estudios y se siente contenta y a la vez muy satisfecha de poder estar logrando uno de sus más deseados sueños de convertirse en una profesional. 
Su anhelo más grande es poder terminar su carrera satisfactoriamente por eso que le pone mucha actitud y ganas de superación, por ello solicitó el préstamo para la implementación de sus materiales académicos (guantes, guardapolvo, mascarillas, computadora) ya que le piden en su Centro de Estudios para poder hacer sus trabajos; y así la joven poder desenvolverse de manera práctica y tranquila. 
Su sueño es poder culminar sus estudios y ponerse a trabajar por un promedio de 5 a 6 años y luego dedicarse a planificar su propio negocio(Clínica).
texts.en:
Rocio Denisse is 26 years old. Currently, she is studying obstetrics at her university. Her major consists of five years of study, and she now is in her last year.

She works as an obstetrician in different posts and hospitals completing her pre-professional practices. She dedicates five hours to studying and she is happy and also very satisfied to be able to be attaining one of her greatest dreams of becoming a professional.

Her greatest wish is to be able to finish her studies satisfactorily, and it is because of this that she has a great attitude and desire for self-improvement. For this, she requested the loan to purchase her academic materials (gloves, lab coat, masks, computer) since her Study Center requires them to be able to do her work. With this, the young woman will be able to continue in a practical and calm manner.

Her dream is to be able to finish her studies and put herself to work for an average of 5 to 6 years, afterwards dedicating herself to planning her own business (clinic).

loans.use: to buy educational supplies.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
Hipólito tiene  32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hija en el distrito de Pomahuaca, donde su población se dedica al comercio de frutales y ganadería,  que pertenece a la ciudad e Jaén, región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.
Son una familia que se dedica hace 8  años a la venta de combustible gasolina, dicho negocio se ubica en el Caserío Campamento Limón, su esposa con la ayuda de su hija crían animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio que luego lo ofrecen a sus clientes que a la ve son sus vecinos.
Hipólito ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para adquirir en mayor cantidad gasolina y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Hipólito is 32 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in the Pomahuaca district, part of the city of Jaén in the Cajamarca region of Peru's Sierra Norte. The population earns a living selling fruits and livestock.

The family has earned a living selling gasoline fuel for about eight years. Their business is located in the Limón village camp. With the help of his daughter, his wife raises small animals in the back of their home which are later sold to their customers, who are their neighbors.

Hipólito has asked for a loan of 1,000 new soles to buy a greater amount of gasoline and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline fuel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize to  prepare more of her tasty "kenkey"

loans.name: Ihanika Group

texts.en:
Margret is a member of the Ihanika Group. She is married with four children who are all in school. Her husband is disabled due to an accident and cannot work.

Margret operates a small shop as well as raises chickens. She uses the money from her chickens to maintain her shop and cover home expenses. Poultry diseases and the high cost of chicken feed are a challenge for her, as well as the costs from taking her husband to the hospital. Despite these challenges, Margret is a hardworking lady who works endlessly to take care of the family single-handedly.

Margret’s group is applying for a 3,300,000 UGX loan through UFAGODE. She will use her 400,000 UGX portion of the loan to buy feed for her hens and add more stock to her shop.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cassava, plantains, and palm oil to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional cassava and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plastic bowls and cooking utensils   to sell

loans.name: Edgardo Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael tiene 19 años de edad, vive junto a sus tíos en la zona rural de Pomahuaca, donde su población se dedica al comercio de frutales y agricultura, dicho distrito pertenece a la Jaén que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte el Perú.

Hace un año, brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros mediante una mototaxi, cuenta con movilidad propia y es conocido en la zona por el traslado a escolares a su centro educativo, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para comprar repuestos para su vehículo que le van a permitir trabajar con mayor seguridad y de esta manera seguir generando ingresos para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Ismael is 19 years old and lives with his uncle and aunt in the rural part of Pomahuaca. Its population works in agriculture and selling fruits. The district belongs to Jaén which is located in the Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

Since one year back Ismael is offering transport services by the means of a motorcycle taxi. He owns his own vehicle and is known in the area for driving children to their schools. He has requested a loan of 500 PEN in order to buy vehicle parts. This will allow him to work more safely, thus continuing to generate an income and support his family.

loans.use: to buy vehicle parts

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 35 years old and married. She has two children, aged two and ten years. She runs a business, selling domestic products in Tombo, in the Western Area Rural District of Sierra Leone. She started the business because she wanted to improve the condition of her family. She's been in this business since after the war. She sells items such as glass cups, knives, and food containers, to people of her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is a poor business location.

Esther requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone. She will use the loan to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers, for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers, for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory level, which will enable her to sell a greater quantity of salted fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her existing stocks of yams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase her existing capacity of fried fish, gari, kenkey, and other food stuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooked wheat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional soap and palm kernel oil to sell

loans.name: Dankey

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Dankey, from Waterloo, in the Western Area region of Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children. In 2003, Kadiatu established her firewood business. She began her business, because she needed to create income to support her household. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Dankey requires a loan, in order to buy more wood to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Dankey plans to change her business to a big provisions shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of doughnuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of fabric and an additional sewing machine

loans.name: José Abel De Jesús

texts.es:
José de 66 años, debido a la condición económica de su familia, solo pudo estudiar hasta un 4º grado, ya que tenia que trabajar todos los días y con mucho esfuerzo estudiaba; luego solo se dedico al trabajo agrícola pero hace unos años por iniciativa de sus hijos, continuo con sus estudios  en la nocturna y trabajaba en el día, logro sacar hasta un 7º grado. Después, ya no pudo seguir porque se le era mas difícil el trabajo. Es casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, 5 de sus hijos, ya son mayores de edad y han formado sus propias familias y dos de ellos están estudiando uno en bachillerato y el otro en primer año de universidad. Ellos dos son los que dependen exclusivamente de él.

José se a dedicado a trabajar la agricultura desde muy pequeño, ya que su padre le enseño esta labor. También, se dedicaba a trabajar como jornal cuidando animales bovinos. El trabajo agrícola lo realiza en las épocas de invierno los cultivos los realiza a 5 kilómetros de su casa, cuando se va al terreno uno de sus hijos lo traslada a mitad de camino, luego tiene que caminar porque no pueden ingresar vehículos, madruga y se queda si es posible toda la semana en el lugar solo lleva lo necesario en alimentación para mantenerse todo el tiempo que sea necesario.
Sus hijos le ayudan en ocaciones para el pago de mosos, pero no le ayudan directamente en el cultivo.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, para la compra de insumos agrícolas; abonos, fertilizantes, pago de mosos y para preparar la tierra para el cultivo, se espera favorecer mejor el cultivo de maíz y lograr tener al final de la cosecha una mayor producción y tener mejores ingresos para su familia

Espera para el futuro, darles el estudio a sus hijos si es posible hasta que egresen de  la universidad, con el préstamo  tendrá mejores ingresos y la ganancia de la producción de maíz la utilizara para comprar mas ganado de repasto.
texts.en:
José is 66 years old. Due to the economic condition of his family, he was only able to go to school through 4th grade. He had to work every day and put a lot of effort into his studies. 

Later, he only spent his time in agricultural labor, but a few years ago through his children's initiative, he continued his studied at night and worked during the day. He completed through 7th grade. Afterwards, he was not able to continue because his work became more difficult. 

He is married and his wife works on household chores. Five of his children are grown up with their own families. Two of them are studying: one in high school and the other in the first year of university. These two depend exclusively on him.

José has earned his living working in agriculture since he was very young, when his father taught him this work. He also worked for wages taking care of cattle. 

He does agricultural work during the winter and plants his crops five kilometers from his house. When he goes to the territory, one of his sons takes him halfway, and then he had to walk because vehicles can't enter. He goes early in the morning and stays, if possible, all week, only taking what's necessary in food to stay all the time that is needed. His children help him sometimes with paying wages, but don't directly help with the crop.

The credit will be used to buy agricultural inputs: composts, fertilizers, workers' wages, and to prepare the land for the crop. He expects to improve his corn crop and achieve, at the end of harvest, a better production to have better income for his family.

He hopes for the future to give his children education, if possible so they enter university. With the loan, he will have better income and he will use his earnings from the corn to buy more cattle pasture.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs: compost, fertilizers, payment for workers, and to prepare the soil for the crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Kenkey’.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of plantains and yams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘kenkey’.

loans.name: Tayorma Group

texts.en:
Doris is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Doris sells shoes and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Doris will use her share of the loan (1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy a large quantity of shoes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of shoes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of palm kernel oil, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Kenkey’ sales.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo, the eastern area in Freetown. She is widowed with 5 children.  For the past 25 years, Salamatu established her retail business alongside a coal nut and palm oil business at her house. She began her business because she generates her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the slow purchasing power of the customers.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, coconut oil and coal nuts to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, coconut oil and coal nuts to expand her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo in eastern Freetown. She is married and has three children.

For the past twenty years Kadiatu has sold palm oil and cassava bread from her home. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. seven days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to enlarge her business.

Kadiatu is applying for a 800,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more palm oil to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to grow her business and improve her living standards. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Jesus Romeo

texts.es:
Jesús de 32 años de edad, soltero sin hijos, es originario del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. El sauce se caracteriza por comida típica como la cuajada, borona, queso. Jesús es un hombre trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente solo pudo cursar sus estudios de secundaria, y no pudo estudiar una carrera universitaria por falta de recursos económicos, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar contabilidad pública.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad la venta de fritanga en su casa de habitación, la fritanga es la venta de comida típica como los tacos, gallo pinto, manuelitas, enchiladas, carne asada, maduros, tajadas. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus servicios. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para carne, arroz, platanos, cremas, frijoles, verduras, repollos para la elaboración de la comida, y en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Jesús agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jesús is 32 years old, single, and has no children. He is originally from El Sauce, which is located in the north of the country. El Sauce is characterized by typical foods such as milk curd, borona, and cheese. Jesús is a hard-working and responsible man with a great drive to succeed. Unfortunately he was only able to complete middle school and didn't get the opportunity to study at university, but he would have liked to study public accounting.

Thanks to his efforts and his will to get ahead he runs a business selling fritanga in his home. Fritanga is typical food such as tacos, gallo pinto, manuelitas, enchiladas, roast, plantains, and fried plantain. He spends around 10 hours a day offering his services. The purpose of the loan is to buy working capital and to stock his business with food products such as meat, rice, plantains, sour cream, beans, vegetables, and cabbage for preparing dishes; as well as to improve his income in a not-so-distant future. Jesús is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they offer people with scarce economic resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent means of work.

loans.use: to buy working capital and stock his business with food products for preparing dishes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of ingredients thus aiding her to improve her bread sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize and flour, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy increased amounts of maize and cassava

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Nana from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children ages between 13 years old and 25 years old. In 2003, Nana established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Nana requires a loan to buy more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Nana plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Hawa from Waterloo, Eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 12 years and 25 years. 

Twenty years ago, Hawa established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business twelve hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Hawa requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children’s school fees. 

In the future, Hawa plans to change her business to a big provision shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: María Salvadora

texts.es:
María de 29 años,  logro estudiar hasta un bachillerato, luego sus padres ya no le pudieron dar los estudios, para un nivel superior, posteriormente se acompaño. Su compañero de vida,  se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado, uno de sus hijos esta cursando un segundo grado y la otra es una infante. 

María se dedica a los oficios domésticos, al cuido de animales de granja y también le ayuda a su compañero de vida en la agricultura. Cultiva, 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz, esto lo realiza debido a necesidad que presenta su familia y le ayuda a su compañero de vida, cuando le va ayudar tiene que madrugar, ya que los terrenos los tienen a 2 kilómetros de su casa, para preparar los alimentos para su compañero y las personas que van a trabajar.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, para favorecer los cultivos de 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz que tiene su compañero y también en la crianza de unos pollos de engorde.

Ella espera para un futuro, mejorar su pequeña casa y darles el estudio a sus hijos hasta donde sea posible, y anexarle una parte mas a la galera, para que pueda tener una mayor numero de pollos de engorde.
texts.en:
María is 29 years old. She completed high school, but later her parents weren't able to give her higher education and she later accompanied them. 

Her life partner earns a living in agriculture and raising livestock. One of her children is studying in second grade, and the other is an infant.

María works in the home, taking care of farm animals and helping her partner with agriculture. She grows 10,500 square meters of corn, which she does due to her family's need. 

She helps her life partner--when he goes to the fields, he has to get up early because the fields they have are 2 kilometers from the house. She prepares food for her partner and the other people who are going to work.

She will use the loan to support the 10,500 square meters of corn crop that her partner has, and also for raising some chickens to fatten. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her small house, give her children education as far as is possible, and add another part to the gallery so she can have a larger number of chickens to fatten.

loans.use: to support 10,500 square meters of her partner's corn and fatten some chickens.

loans.name: Na God Dae Gee Ii Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Na God Dae Gee II” group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Sia is the featured leader of this group. The 30-year-old is married to a diamond miner, and the couple has three children. Sia has been a businesswoman for seven years now; she sells market-food such as tomatoes, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy tomatoes, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Honest Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu is 30 years old. She is married to a teacher and the couple has 1 child who is attending primary school. 

For 10 years now, Kadiatu has been selling clothes/cloth, etc. Together, they are requesting a loan of 4,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (800,000 SLL) to expand her business. She will buy clothes/cloth in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy clothes/cloth in large quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: G.s A.m.s Group

texts.es:
El G.S A.M.S está conformado por tres integrantes madres solteras, con  siete hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Originarias de Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de salir adelante. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar una carrera, la cual las obligo a trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad sus sueños más deseados es poder trabajar y  sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos y brindarles un futuro mejor y luchar porque sean profesionales.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del g.s  es Heidy y tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos como rubor, labiales, lápiz de ojos, desmaquilladoras, anti ojeras, cremas hidratantes, perfumes, body. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias, ofreciendo su producto de forma ambulante, y en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cosméticos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s A.M.S agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
GSAMS is made up of three single mothers who have seven children they are responsible for. They are native to Nagarote, located in the western part of the country. 

These women are characterized by being hard-working, responsible and wanting to get ahead. Sadly, due to a lack of resources, they weren't able to study a career, which has forced them to work from a young age. 

Currently, their biggest dream is to be able to work and improve the lives of their young children, giving them a better future and struggling for them to become professionals.

Thanks to her effort and desire to succeed, the coordinator of the G.S. is Heidi. Her job is selling cosmetics, such as blush, lipstick, eyeliner, makeup remover, anti-dark circles, moisturizers, perfumes and body. 

She works at her business for eight hours every day, offering her products by walking, and in her house. The goal of the loan is to invest in capital and stock her business for the buying and selling of cosmetics so she can earn better income in the near future. 

The GSAMS group is grateful for the assistance Kiva investors provide to poor people and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a decent working environment.

loans.use: to invest in capital and stock her business in the purchase and sale of cosmetics such as blush, lipstick, eyeliner, makeup remover, anti-dark circles, moisturizers, perfumes and body.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Gari’.

loans.name: Oneness Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Oneness” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Patrick.  Patrick is age 33; he was born in Tankoro in eastern Sierra Leone. His wife is a businesswoman, too. His three children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For six years now, Patrick has been selling bags, belts, etc. With this loan, he is going to buy a large quantity of bags, belts, etc. to add to his business.
