loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bags, belts, etc. to add to his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her existing provision capacity

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Wakye’.

loans.name: Cenit

texts.es: Cenit, de 53 años de edad, está casada y vive en compañia de su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Cenit se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, la cual está implementada en un espacio muy bien  acondicionado en su hogar, lleva más de tres años en está actividad, siendo muy concurrido por los vecinos de la zona, a los cuales atiende de manera amable y con mucha alegría, para esto cuenta con la ayuda de su hija, en la atención cuando ella no se encuentra ò se va a realizar compras para la bodega. Considera rentable su negocio por la constante demanda de sus productos y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta  su actividad pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para pagar los gastos de su casa,  le da tiempo para apoyar a sus hijos, en criar a su nieto cuando está fuera de casa en su trabajo, nos comenta que tiene muchas ganas de ampliar su negocio y variar mas los productos que para así poder tener mas ingresos. Con el préstamo de 1800 nuevos soles, comprará productos comestibles en general para surtir su bodega como arroz, azúcar, aceites, fideos, entre otros, considera que a mayor variedad su negocio tendrá mas acogida.
texts.en:
Cenit, 53 years old, is married and lives with her husband and two children in their own house. 

Cenit earns her living selling food products, which takes place in a very good space attached to his home. She has been doing this for more than three years and is very popular with the residents in the area, who she attends in a friendly and happy manner. For this, she relies on the help of her daughter for care when she is not present or leaves to make purchases for the store.

She believes her business is profitable because of the constant demand for her products and the good returns she gets. 

She likes her job because it allows her to have income to pay household expenses and gives her time to support her children in taking care of her grandchild when she is away from home and at work. 

She said she has a strong desire to expand her business and vary the products more to have better returns. With the loan of 1,800 new soles, she will buy food products in general to stock the store, such as rice, sugar, oils, noodles and more. She believes that with more variety, her business will have better reception.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, sugar, oils, noodles and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes/cloth to add to her business

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 25 years old and lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is married and has one child. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, who makes an income of $2 each day.

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Ny is requesting a loan of $500. She will use the loan to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help reduce her family's expenses. In the future, she would like her husband to become a construction foreman, increasing his income.  In addition, she wants to send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is 24 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Irbid, with his two sisters and his parents. Yousef is in his first year, studying for a Diploma in Civil Engineering. He also works at a cafe. He is planning to continue his study until he gets his Bachelor degree. The degree will enable him to find a better job after graduation, so he will start earning a better income to help his family financially. Yousef doesn't currently have enough money to pay his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees, for his Civil Engineering studies

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is 25 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her husband and 3 children. Her husband is in the military. Amal is studying for Bachelor of Math 4th year. She is planning to continue her study and to work in her study field after graduation to start helping her husband financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Amah

texts.en:
Amah is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She works in a small factory with a monthly salary which she uses to support her family. She assists her husband who works in a medical company to cover house hold expenses. 

Amah is applying for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase a laptop to use for her career. By taking this loan, Amah will be able to prepare reports and documents. She and her husband hope to improve their living standards. Amah appears in the photo with laptop bag.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to use for her career.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 22 years old. He lives at a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his six siblings and his parents. One of his brothers is in the military. 

Abdullah is in his fourth year, studying for a Bachelor of Law degree. He is planning to continue his studies to be able to find a job in his study field after graduation, so he can start earning a better income to help his family financially. 

Abdullah doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Subheyeh

texts.en:
Subheyeh was born in 1958. She is married and lives at a sector in Jordan called Wihdat; her husband is a mechanic. 

Subheyeh has been selling blankets for a year. She started selling a small quantity of blankets to her neighbors and close friends, and she found it profitable and a good financial support for her family. 

Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of blankets to raise her profit and income. But she doesn't have enough money to do so, so she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets for her business

loans.name: Naela

texts.en:
Naela was born in 1981. She is single and lives with her family and four siblings at a sector in Jordan called Deiralla. 

Naela has been working at her mini market for a year. She started selling a small quantity of foodstuffs to her neighbors and close friends, and she found it profitable and a good financial support for her family. So she opened her own mini-market, and now she wants to stock it with food products and other products to raise her profit and income. 

But she doesn't have enough money to do so, so she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more food products for her mini- market

loans.name: Sereena

texts.en: Sereena is 22 years old. She lives in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Salt, with her two sisters and her parents. Her father works in a governmental entity. Sereena is in her first year, studying for a Bachelor of Management Information Systems. She is planning to continue her study and to work in her study field after graduation, to start helping her family financially. They are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees and pursue her Bachelor of Management Information Systems degree

loans.name: Enas

texts.en: Enas is 18 years old. She lives in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat, with her three siblings and her parents. Enas is in her first year of studying for a Bachelor of Accounting degree. She is planning to continue her study and work in her study field after graduation, to start helping her family financially. They are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees and pursue her Bachelor of Accounting degree

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Ángeles” está  conformado por 14 socios responsables y dinámicos. Isabel de 57 años es viuda con 02 hijos independientes. Isabel cuenta con un kiosco la cual ofrece golosinas y comidas, siendo sus mayores clientes vecinos de su zona. Se siente feliz pues con su esfuerzo ha podido mejorar su vivienda y mantener su negocio. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de golosinas y bebidas. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su vivienda. El grupo “Los Ángeles” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Isabel se encuentra en la parte posterior es la cuarta del lado izquierdo, viste blusa celeste. En la parte superior lado derecho se encuentra  Charlie la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo
texts.en:
The group “Los Ángeles” (The Angels) is made up of 14 responsible and dynamic members. Isabel is 57 years old. She is a widow with two independent children. 

Isabel has a small stand which offers candy and food. Her main customers are neighbors from her area. She feels glad because through her efforts, she has been able to improve her home and maintain her business. 

Her most recent loan will be used for the purchase of candy and drinks. Her greatest wish is to complete the construction of her home. The group “Los Ángeles” is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they have offered. 

Isabel is in the back, fourth from the left, wearing a sky-blue blouse. In the top part on the right is Charlie, who wasn’t able to come on time because of work.

loans.use: to purchase candy and drinks.

loans.name: Daves Samir

texts.es:
Daves es un joven de 18 años que vive en distrito de Parcona, Ica; Perú. Daves es un joven muy trabajador, para poder tener ingresos y seguir adelante trabaja como empleado en una empresa de transportes de la ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y cree que le va bien n su trabajo porque es responsable y puntual.

Daves está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una cama ortopédica para su abuela, ya que ella sufre de dolencias en la columna, de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su abuela, así poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Daves is an 18-year old young man who lives in the district of Parcona, Ica (Perú). Daves works very hard to earn money and get ahead. He is an employee at a transportation company in the city and works for approximately 10 hours a day. He thinks things are going well at work because he is responsible and punctual. 

Daves is grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, he will be able to buy an orthopaedic bed for his grandmother, who has back pain, and to improve her quality of live. He wants to keep working towards his big dream: "To have his own house".

loans.use: to buy an orthopaedic bed.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is 24 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Salt, with his three siblings and his parents. Hani is studying Geometrics and Space Engineering and is in his fifth year. He also works at a supermarket. He is planning to continue his study until he gets his Bachelor degree, to be able to find a better job after graduation. He expects to start earning a better income and helping his family, financially. Hani doesn't currently have enough money to pay his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees and pursue his Bachelor degree in Geometrics and Space Engineering

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en la comunidad Oyotun, donde su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y cultivos de yuca, arroz, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, en la parte posterior de su domicilio y ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para comprar de animales pequeños, luego engordarlo y venderlos a mejor precio y de esta manera seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fabiola is 36 years old. She lives together with her two children in the community of Oyotun, where the population works in the business of young animals and farming yucca and rice. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Perú. 

She works raising and selling livestock behind her house, and she has requested a loan of 1200 nuevos soles for the purchase of young stock. Later, she will fatten them and sell them at a better price, and in this way continue generating income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase young animals.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel was born in 1966. He is married and lives with his wife and four children in a sector of Jordan called Baqaa. One of his sons is currently working at a bakery and the rest of the children are students. 

Adel has been working at his blacksmith workshop for nine years. He is the only supporter for his family and he is trying his best to provide his children with the best education. He is planning to expand his business to raise his profit, in order to be able to cover his family's needs. 

To do so, Adel needs to buy new machines for his workshop which he doesn't have enough money for. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his shop.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 54 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hija en la zona rural de Pomahuaca donde su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y cultivo de frutales, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de animales ovejas, chivos, cerdos, asnos y también se dedica al cultivo de cacao, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para abonar su finca y de esta manera tener una buena cosecha, la otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Roberto, age 54, lives with his wife and daughter in the rural area of Pomahuaca.  The population there devotes itself to selling small animals and growing fruit.  It is two hours from the city of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He sells animals like sheep, goats, pigs, and donkeys.  He also grows cacao.

He has requested a loan for 2,500 nuevo soles to fertilizer his farm.  This way he will have a good harvest.  He will use the other part of the money to buy sheep in order to continue selling them to his customers.

loans.use: to buy sheep and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville, one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and has five children between the ages of one month and 12 years old. They all live at home and only four attend school.

Annie was unable to attend school, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a businessman. For the past three years, she has been selling red oil in the local market. Now she faces no problems, she sells every day and spends 12 hours with her business. She started this business with  a little income she received from her husband. 

Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. She hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Nardino Aminadab

texts.es:
El joven Nardino de 26 años,  logro estudiar hasta un bachillerato, luego decidió viajar hacia los Estados Unidos y se dedico a trabajar  y adquirir algunos bienes; posteriormente se regreso a su país.  Su compañera de vida, se dedica a trabajar como enfermera, su hija es una infante de 10 meses de edad.

Él por su parte, se dedica al cultivo de 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, esta actividad se la enseño su padre; quien también se dedica a trabajar la agricultura, lo ha hecho desde que estaba muy pequeño; debido a que estudiaba y a la vez trabajaba con su padre. Luego, se dedico al comercio de ganado, esta actividad se la enseño un amigo con el que actualmente trabaja en los tiangues. También, se a dedicado a la crianza de pollos de engorde y  la crianza de bovinos de repasto. En la época agrícola tiene que madrugar, ya que los cultivos los tiene a dos kilómetros de su casa, también ordeña dos vacas lecheras antes de dirigirse a dicho lugar.

Los fondos del crédito serán destinados en la compra de una vaca lechera, 300 pollos de engorde y  concentrados para los pollos.

 Espera para un futuro, tener su propia casa donde puedan vivir con su familia, ademas ampliar mas la galera donde tienen los pollos y poder criar mas, ademas espera  seguir estudiando para cursar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Nardino, 26 years old, was able to complete high school. He decided to travel to the United States to work and obtain some assets. Afterwards, he returned to his country. His life partner works as a nurse and they have a ten-month-old daughter.

Nardino cultivates 14,000 square meters of corn. His father, who also works in agriculture, taught him this activity. He’s done this since he was little because he studied at the same time as he worked with his father. Then, he worked in the cattle business. A friend, who he currently works with in the market, taught him this activity. He is also involved in raising and fattening chickens and in breeding cattle for grazing. When working in agriculture, he has to wake up early since his crops are 2 kilometers from his house. He also milks 2 cows before he heads out.

This loan will be used to buy a milk cow, 300 chickens to fatten, and chicken feed. In the future, Nardino hopes to have his own house where he can live with his family and be able to expand his chicken pen so he can raise more. He also hopes to keep studying so he can complete a university degree.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow, 300 chickens to fatten, and chicken feed.

loans.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es: Rebeca de 32 años separada con 02 hijos aún dependientes, actualmente  es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal  “Las Tres Marías” conformada por 06 mujeres responsables, dicho grupo pasan a su 10 ciclo. Con los deseos de superarse y contar con un negocio propio  Rebeca inicia su negocio, la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad en su vivienda. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito para la compra de abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas.  El anhelo de Rebeca es de crecer más su negocio. El grupo “Las Tres Marías” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Rebeca  se encuentra sentada y viste chompa ploma.
texts.en: 32 year old Rebeca is separated and has 2 children who are dependent on her. She is currently a member of the loan group "The Three Marías", which is comprised of 6 responsible women and which is in it's 10th loan cycle. With the desire to overcome problems and have her own business, Rebeca began her business selling staple goods from her home. With the goal of continuing to improve, she requested a loan to buy groceries, candy, and drinks. Her great desire is to grow her business more. The group "The Three Marías" is grateful to the people who made possible this loan and promised to keep working well. Rebeca is seated in the photo and wears a grey sweater.

loans.use: to buy candy, groceries, and drink.

loans.name: Gharam

texts.en:
Gharam is 21 years old. She lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with her five siblings and her parents. Her father is a retired man. 

Gharam is studying for a Bachelor of English Language, fourth year. She is planning to continue her study in order to work in her study field after graduation, to start financially helping her family since they are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Fredesbinda

texts.es:
Fredesbinda tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo, en la zona rural de Zaña, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura ya que las tierras son muy fértiles y comercio de animales menores a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales menores, en la parte posterior a su domicilio desde hace 05 años y ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de animales pequeños y posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a mejor precio en su distrito y comunidades aledañas, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fredesbinda is 33 years old and lives with her husband and son in the rural area of Zaña where people work in agriculture because the land is fertile and raise small animals. The area is 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is in the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Perú.
She works raising and selling small animals behind her home and has been doing his for 5 years. She has requested a loan of $1,475 to buy small animals and then fatten them and offer them for a better price in her district and surrounding communities. This will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy small animals: ducks, hens, guinea pigs

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is 21 years old. He is a single man living in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Adnan is an employee in the government sector getting a low salary, which is barely enough to cover his family's needs. He works hard to access financial resources easily. 

He has requested a loan of YER 100,000 to help cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help him with his homework and reports. This will ensure a better future and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop to support his work.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La Sra. Ángela de 57 años de edad, casada con hijos mayores de edad e independiente. Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  la venta de mercadería en general como pantalones, camisas, vestidos, shrot, toallas, camisolas, ropa de cama, ropa de niños, ropa interior. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo su mercadería, actividad que la desempeña en un lugar especifico de la localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Ángela agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
57 year old Angela is married with two grown children. She is originally from Leon, a place in the west of the country. She can be characterized as being responsible, hardworking, and with a great personal desire to overcome problems. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she was obliged to work from a very early age to help with the household expenses. 
Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, she has a business selling general merchandise such as pants, shirts, dresses, shorts, towels, camisoles, bed clothes, kids' clothes, and underwear. She works about 8 hours a day, and does this from a fixed place. The goal of the loan is to have business capital to invest in supplying her business buying and selling merchandise so that, in the not-to-distant future she can have better income. Angela is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help that they offer to people who have scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: for business capital and to supply her business buying and selling merchandise such as pants, shirts, dresses, shorts, towels, camisoles, underwear, kids' clothes, bed clothes.

loans.name: Maen

texts.en:
Maen is 19 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with his five siblings and his parents. 

Maen is studying for a Bachelor of Nursing. He is in his first year. He is planning to continue his study, in order to be able to find a job in his study field after graduation, to start earning a better income, so he can financially help his family. 

Currently, Maen doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is 21 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq, with his seven siblings and his parents. 

Emad is studying for a Bachelor of Earth Sciences degree. He is in his second year. He is planning to continue his study, in order to be able to find a job in his study field after graduation, to start earning a better income, so he can financially help his family. 

Currently, Emad doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Yesenia Marisol

texts.es:
Yesenia de 35 años, vive junto a sus pequeños hijos los cuales tienen las edades de 9- 7 y 4 años.
Ella tiene un nivel académico de bachillerato general y preparada en cosmetología, la cual es la actividad que ejerce actualmente y vive junto a su esposo.


Desde hace 2 años ejerce la actividad de cosmetóloga, es propietaria del negocio y lo aprendió en una academia de cosmetología en la ciudad.

El préstamo será invertido,  para comprar arena y cemento  para la remodelación de su vivienda, para ejercer una mejor presentación en su negocio.


Planea tener un negocio que le permita la sostenibilidad de su familia y que le permita otorgarle a sus pequeños, una buena educación y una vivienda que reúna las condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 35 years old, She lives together with her young children, who are 9, 7 and 4 years old. She has a general certificate and is trained in cosmetology, which is the work that she does currently. She lives with her husband.

For 2 years, she has worked as a cosmetologist. She is the business owner, and she learned this is at a cosmetology academy in her city. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of sand and cement for remodeling her home in order to have a better presentation for her business. She plans to have a business that will allow her to support her family and to give her little ones a good education and a home that meets her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase sand and cement for remodeling her home in order to have a better presentation for her business.

loans.name: Veronica Rosario

texts.es:
Veronica tiene 50 años y vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ella trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, abarrotes y bebidas como cerveza y gaseosas, para Verónica su negocio es muy importante ya que es su única fuente de ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, ya que ella es madre de 2 hijos a los cuales ama muchísimo.

Veronica esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como cervezas al por mayor y también productos de bazar, así ella podrá ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y poder hacer realidad su sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Verónica, 50, lives in the city of Chincha.  She's the mother of two children whom she loves a lot.

Verónica works in her small business selling clothing, groceries, and beverages such as beer and soda.  Her business is very important to her because it's her only source of income for paying her household expenses.

Verónica's grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy more merchandise for her business, such as beer wholesale and products for her store.  This way she'll be able to sell more products to her customers and achieve her dream of finishing building her house of quality materials.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is 29 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Madaba, with his one brother and his parents. 

Emad is studying for a Bachelor of Social Work degree. He's in his third year. He is planning to continue his study in order to be able to find a job in his study field after graduation, to start earning a better income, so he can financially help his family. 

Currently, Emad doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia was born in 1991. She is married and lives in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat. Her husband works for a governmental entity. 

Dalia has been selling clothes for one year. She started her business selling a small quantity of clothes to her neighbors and close friends. She found it to be profitable and a good financial support for her husband. 

Now, she wants to buy a larger quantity of clothes to raise her profits and income. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fawaz

texts.en: Fawaz is a 23-year-old, married man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has gone through some hardships in his life. However, because of his dedication and desire to get ahead in life, he has been able to overcome these difficulties and make progress, together with his family. He owns a spice shop where he offers basic consumer goods for sale. He has been operating his business for two years. He started his business with a small grocery store, then he sold it to his brother and was able to establish a spice shop. Recently, his inventory of merchandise has diminished considerably. With the intention of increasing the quantity of products that he offers, he wants to buy more food products to display for his customers. However, he does not have enough capital to make all of these purchases. For this reason, he requested a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. This loan will allow him to buy different kinds of spices in order to expand his business. In the future, he would like to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of spices in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha was born in 1977. She is married and lives in a sector of Jordan called Deiralla, with her husband and four children. Her husband works for a governmental entity. 

Maha has been selling blankets for one year. She started her business selling a small quantity of them to her neighbors and close friends and she found it to be profitable and a good financial support for her husband. 

Now, she wants to buy a larger quantity of blankets to raise her profits and income. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for her business.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en: This is Tamer’s second loan cycle from Ryada. His previous loan helped him to develop his business and had a positive outcome. His sales also increased. Today, Tamer is planning to keep on developing his business to make sure that his children will have the best living and education, and at the same time, to ensure that his customers are satisfied. He wants to use this loan to purchase a microscope for accurate maintenance.

loans.use: to buy more electronics and maintenance tools.

loans.name: Mutaz

texts.en: Mutaz was born in 1989. He is single and lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with his parents and three siblings. Mutaz has been selling mosaics for one year. He learned how to make them while working at the Scholars palace in Jordan. Then he started making them by himself at his house and selling them. He found this project profitable and now he needs to buy a larger quantity of raw materials and tools for his project such as pigments, paint with various colors and hammers in order to expand it successfully. However, he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy pigments, paint with various colors and hammers for his business

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad is 21 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his 4 siblings and his parents. His father works as a taxi driver. Murad is studying in his 3rd year of his Bachelor of Accounting. He is planning to continue his studies to find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help his family financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Maram

texts.en: Maram was born in 1991. She is single and lives with her family and 3 siblings in a sector in Jordan called Sothern Ghour. Maram has been working at her mini-market for 6 years. She started her project selling a small quantity of food products to her neighbors and close friends, and she found it profitable and a good financial support for her family. So she opened her own mini market and now she wants to buy the products that her customers requested and to buy a refrigerator where she can keep cold drinks. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more food products and a refrigerator for her business

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Because Raeda is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture.

Raeda is a married woman who lives in a sector in Jordan called Salt with her 5 children and her husband. Her husband is a retired man.

Raeda’s oldest son is studying Bachelor of Air Conditioning and Refrigerating 2nd year, and he works at a governmental entity. He is planning to continue his studies to find a good job in his study field after graduation to start helping his family financially, as they are currently facing financial crisis which is not helping them in paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Raeda applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her sons' upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 29 years old; he lives in Gaza with his wife and two daughters. 
He takes photos for weddings, birthdays, and any occasion that the customers want. This activity is his only financial income. He earns $708 monthly.
Mohammad asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a new video camera and another one for photography pictures. 
Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new video camera and another one for photography pictures.

loans.name: Hazim

texts.en:
Hazim is a 29-year-old; he is from Gaza. He intends to start his new business, a garage for repairing cars and selling car oils.

Hazim asking Ryada for this startup loan to make decorations and buy equipment like car parts for maintenance issues. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success and start this new business.

Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the startup enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to make decorations and buy equipment like car parts

loans.name: Hanen

texts.en:
Haneen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her father appears in the photo.

Haneen is a 23-year-old single young lady from Gaza City. She lives with her parents and brothers in a small house. Haneen's father is an employee in the public sector. Haneen works in a local company and helps her family with part of the monthly expenses.

Haneen took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the costs of an urgent surgery for her father. This will improve his health conditions and complete his work.

loans.use: to pay the costs of an urgent surgery for her father

loans.name: Sithon

texts.en:
Sithon is a 33-year-old, married woman with three school-aged students. 

She has been a farmer for the past ten years and she also works in a garment factory when she completes her farming tasks within the rainy season. She cultivates the land for sustenance only and works in the factory to earn additional income to cover her daily expenses. The challenge for Sithon and her husband is to pay for their traveling costs every day because they don’t have their own motorcycle at home. 

To help them fulfill their transportation needs, Sithon has applied for a loan, in the amount of KHR 4,000,000, to buy a used motorcycle, which will allow them to work without paying much on a daily basis. This will be a great help for her family. She is very thankful to all kind lenders who always support her family.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is 25 years old; he lives in Gaza. He sells kinds of homemade sweets such as cookies and pies; he started working at this business in 2010, he earned $403 monthly.

Jihad is requesting this youth loan of $1500 to purchase a blender and heating machine for the hot sweets so he is able to increase his stock.

He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal; his dream is to open a shop for sweets. Jihad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a blender and heating machine for the hot sweets

loans.name: Aymen

texts.en:
Aymen is 23 years old and lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He has been operating a grocery store. He is ambitious to work in this field so that his life will go well. Aymen benefited from the first loan which was funded through Kiva.

With this loan, he is planning to expand his business and stock it with additional products. He asked for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy grocery items to generate greater profits. He thanks Kiva lenders for funding him the first loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to generate greater profits.

loans.name: Apevatt

texts.en:
Apevatt is 22 years old and a single man living with his parents in Siem Reap province. He just finished his high school level this year and is planning to continue his education at the university.

Apevatt is an industrious person who always helps his parents in their business of selling bread from their own home when he gets free time from school. He is also employed as a waiter in a restaurant to earn money to further his education. He aims to study banking at South East Asia University because he realizes that this field is very popular in the present market and it will allow him to have a well-paying job in the future.

Due to the lack of money, Apevatt would like borrow a loan of USD 500 to pay for his education fees. Through the loan support this time, Apevatt will have enough time to save money for the next academic program. Apevatt was pictured while he was helping his parents serve the clients at home. His parents, who are not included in the picture, will be his joint borrowers and be responsible for the principal repayment.

Apevatt expresses thanks to all people around the world who contribute their funds via Kiva programs to help students further their education.

loans.use: to pay for his education fees.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea is 36 years old and a resident from Kampong Cham province. She has been married for years but unfortunately she doesn't have any children. Sothea devotes herself to a farming business, primarily growing rice on a few pieces of land alongside her lovely husband. She has been doing this business for nearly 15 years, and earns a decent income to pay for the living costs.

At the moment, Sothea has requested a loan of 800 US dollars which will enable her to buy materials needed to build a latrine and hire people to perform the construction. Sothea realizes that by having a latrine at home she will be able to keep her family healthy and promote their health. She thanks lenders for their loan support via programs like Kiva to help low-income families gain access to sanitation and increase their personal hygiene.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to build a latrine and hire people to perform the construction.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy, de 47 años de edad,  es una mujer  alegre y trabajadora. Está casada y tiene 04 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Lucy, se dedica a la fabricación de palos de escoba, trabajo que realiza en un local alquilado en donde tiene todas las herramientas necesarias para su trabajo, atendiendo los pedidos de sus innumerables clientes. Lleva más de 15 años  dedicándose  a dicha actividad, el cual lo realiza con el apoyo de su esposo y 02 ayudantes, de ésta manera brinda trabajo y un ingreso de dinero a otras personas las cuales están muy agradecidas. Considera rentable a su negocio por la demanda que tiene y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Este es el quinto préstamo con Kiva, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.800 nuevos soles, comprará la materia prima necesaria para su negocio como es la madera en mayor cantidad y menor precio generándole mayor ganancias.
texts.en:
Lucy at 47 years old is a happy and hard-working woman. She is married and has 4 children whom she lives with in her own house. Lucy makes broomsticks. She does this out of a rented space where she has all the tools necessary for her work, looking after the needs of her many customers. 

She has been in this business for more than 15 years which she carries out with the help of her husband and two assistants. Working in this way she provides work and a source of income for other people, who are very grateful for this. Lucy considers her business profitable for the demand she has and the good profits that it provides. 

This is her fifth loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial assistance that allows her to get ahead. She promises to pay her installments on time. With the loan of 800 PEN Lucy will buy raw materials needed in her business such as wood in volume, at a low price in order to generate greater revenues.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 22-year-old from Gaza. In 2010 he thought of doing something to contribute to the family income, as his parents' income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of all the family members.

From 2010 until now he has been sewing clothes for many shops in his area and distributes them with help from his brothers. His dream is to make his own brand and in large areas.

Khaled is asking Ryada for this loan to buy another sewing machine and shelves. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine and shelves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for his store as the demand for products is high. Plus he will buy a loudspeaker for his sound system.

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Responsabilidad Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Prosperidad Y Responsabilidad” la cual está conformada por 06 socios dispuestos a comenzar a trabajar unidos. Ana de 32 años es separada con 03 hijos en etapa escolar. Hace más de 04 años que Ana se dedica a la venta de productos naturales (omnilife) la cual los ofrece a pedidos. Con su trabajo Ana ha podido mejorar su vivienda. El crédito que solicitó lo invertirá para la compra de productos naturales como tónicos, jalea real, miel de abeja entre otros. El anhelo de Ana es de instalar un puesto donde pueda exhibir sus productos. El nuevo grupo “Prosperidad  y Responsabilidad” agradecen por la ayuda brindada. Ana es la segunda del lado izquierdo, viste casaca ploma y pantalón azul. En la parte superior lado izquierdo esta la socia Juana que por motivo de trabajo no pudo llegar a tiempo.
texts.en:
This is the new group “Prosperidad Y Responsabilidad” which is composed of six members who are ready to start to work together. 

Ana is 32 years old, separated and has three children who attend school. For more than 15 years she has sold natural products (Omnilife) which she sells on demand. With her work Ana has been able to improve her life. The loan Ana is requesting is to be invested in buying natural products like tonics, royal jelly and bee's honey etc. 

The new group “Prosperidad Y Responsabilidad” is thankful for the support offered to them. Ana is the second from the left in the photo, wearing a grey hoodie and blue jeans. In the upper left insert is Juana who because of work could not arrive at the meeting on time.

loans.use: to buy tonics, royal jelly and bee's honey.

loans.name: Andrea Adelaida

texts.es:
Andrea tiene 19 años y es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo se encuentra estudiando la carrera de contabilidad y para poder solventar sus estudios trabaja como asistente contable en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad, Andrea cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable.

Andrea esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que  le han brindado ella podrá comprar abarrotes al por mayor, de esta manera ella podrá apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar y poder seguir estudiando y trabajando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Acabar su carrera y tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Andrea is 19 and is a young woman with great desire to get ahead. For this reason and with great effort she is studying to be an accountant. To pay for her studies she works as an assistant accountant in a small company in her city.  Andrea feels that her work is going well for her because she is very responsible.

Andrea is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their help she can buy groceries wholesale. In this way she can help her mother with the household expenses and can continue to study and work. She wants to fulfill her great dream which is to complete her education and own her own home.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale.

loans.name: Kanymkul

texts.ru: Канымкул 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Канымкул - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Канымкул занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Канымкул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Канымкул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Канымкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Kanymkul is 43, married, and raising 4 children together with her husband.  She has the equivalent of a high-school education and raises livestock for a living, having started 8 years ago with 5,000 somoni worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, her farm currently has a dairy cow and 5 sheep, while her monthly income is nearly 5,000 somoni.  To further develop her farm, Kanymkul is seeking a loan of 50,000 somoni from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy cattle.  She plans on using the extra money that the loan will allow her to make to continue to buy more livestock, as well as to set aside money for her children's education.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita, de 46 años de edad, está casada y vive en su casa propia con su esposo, sus padres y sus 02 hijos, los cuales están estudiando en la universidad para forjarse un mejor futuro. El trabajo que realiza Anita es el alquiler de cabinas de Internet, donde tiene 06 computadoras bien instaladas y siendo muy concurrido ya que es la única por la zona, está instalado en un local acondicionado en su propia casa.  Este negocio viene funcionando desde hace más de 06 años, tiempo en cual le ha valido para hacerse muy conocida, para esta actividad cuenta con el apoyo de un ayudante al cual paga por medio tiempo en las tardes,  ya que por las mañanas le apoya su hija.Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.Le gusta su trabajo ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico para el sustento de la economía familiar y para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.Este es el préstamo número 06 con Kiva, se siente muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera putual.
Con el préstamo solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprara teclados de computadoras, Mouse, cables de Internet y demás accesorios para sus computadoras.
texts.en:
Anita, who is 46 years old, is married and lives in her own house with her husband, her parents, and her two children, who are studying at the university in order to forge a better future. Anita's work is renting internet booths, where she has six well installed computers, which are very busy since [her business] is the only one in the area. It is set up in a specially prepared area in her own home. This business has been functioning for more than six years, during which time it has become very well known. For this work, she has the help of an assistant whom she pays for half time in the afternoons, since her daughter helps her in the mornings. She considers her business profitable because of the good earnings that it brings her. She likes her work, since it allows her to have an economic income for the sustenance of the family economy and to pay for her children's education. This is her sixth loan with Kiva. She feels very happy about the financial support that she receives to continue forward. In addition, she promises to make her payments in a punctual manner. 

With the loan of 1500 new soles that she has applied for, she will buy computer keyboards, mice, internet cables, and other accessories for her computers.

loans.use: to buy keyboards, mice, internet cables, etc.

loans.name: Sokchan

texts.en:
Sokchan is 20 years old and a single woman living with her parents and other siblings in Preah Sihanouk province. She is a year-three student at UME University and also works as an assistant administrator at the same place. 

She normally earns a salary of $110 per month. She has been in this occupation since she graduated from high school in 2010. Due to the family’s financial constraints, Sokchan is experiencing difficulties to cover her education costs, so she decided to take out a loan in the amount of $500, which will enable her to continue her education. 

Her main major is accounting and finance. She was interested in this field because it’s suitable to her personality. After graduation, she expects to have a high-paying job, so she can help her parents and younger brothers and sisters with their education. Sokchan’s parents, who are not included in the picture, will be her joint borrowers and be responsible for the principal repayment. 

Sokchan expresses her thanks to all people around the world who contribute their funds via the Kiva program to help students further their education.

loans.use: to pay for her education fees.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang is 43 years old, married and has two adult children. She owns and manages a farming business in Bakan district, Pursat province. Leang has been doing this since she was a young girl, always helping her parents work with the land. Having been in this business for many years, she is able to make a net income of $8.33 per day. Her husband also works in the same business.

Leang wanted to improve her living conditions, so she has requested a loan of $1,000, which will enable her to buy materials needed to build a latrine and hire people to perform the construction. Leang, being a responsible mother and wife, always tries her best to provide a comfortable lifestyle and keep her family members healthy. She thank lenders for their loan support via the programs like Kiva to help low-income families gain access to sanitation and increase their personal hygiene.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to build a latrine and hire people to perform the construction.

loans.name: Kao

texts.en:
Kao is 43 years old and married with four children. All of them currently live with her and her husband in their own home located in Pursat province. As other villagers, Kao is in the business of farming rice, which is the sole source of the family’s income. Managing about 2 hectares of farmland, she is able to make a net income of 23,000 KHR [Cambodian riels] per day.

Kao wants to have a latrine for her home because she doesn't have it yet. Therefore, she has applied for a 2,000,000 KHR loan, which will enable her to buy materials needed to build a latrine and hire people to perform the construction. Kao is very happy and thankful for the loan granted to allow her to improve her living conditions, gain access to sanitation and increase their personal hygiene.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to build a latrine and hire people to perform the construction.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 27-year-old who lives in a poor area in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a hardworking and kindly man who strives to provide for his family. He is technical electrician earning a low income that is not enough to cover his family's expenses. He suffers a financial challenge, because he doesn't have a second source of income to improve his living standards. Sometimes, he faces a difficult challenge to cover home improvement for his house. So, he applied for a loan from AMB to buy home appliances for his house. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for his house.

loans.name: Al-Slama Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Slama. It consists of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 210,000 YER [Yemen rials] from AMB. 

Among the borrowers is Nwal, who is a hardworking woman. Nwal is 47 years old, married, and has children. She sells many types of products like clothes, incense and perfumes. She assists her husband in supporting their children because she knows her husband's income is not enough to cover the family expenses. Unfortunately, the money she and her husband make is really not enough to buy a home appliance. She listened to her friends about AMB, so she is requesting a loan from AMB to buy a washing machine for her house. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her house.

loans.name: Al-Razy Group

texts.en: The Al-Razy group is made up of three ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. The members have different types of businesses. Elham is 50 years old and the mother of four children. She lives with them in Aden, Yemen. She sells many items for her business like perfume, clothes, etc. She is focused on her business because this is a great help in improving her economic conditions. As time passes and her customers' needs grow, she doubles her seriousness. But seriousness and hard work aren't enough. As a result, she is requesting a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy perfume, clothes, etc. as additional commodities to sell. She hopes to gain more profits through these goods in order to be able to provide a good living for her family.

loans.use: to buy perfume, clothes, etc. as additional commodities to sell.

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Bindu is 57 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 40. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Bindu plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Neiber

texts.es: Neiber desde muy joven le gustó el arte de confeccionar, por eso desde sus 14 años inició su experiencia incipiente y posteriormente para emprender su propio negocio estudió en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje, escuela tecnica de Colombia, apoyada por el Gobierno Nacional, y logró perfeccionar las técnicas y desarrollar un proceso mas efectivo. Hoy, casada se dedica junto a su cónyuge a la eleboración de uniformes y de ropa en general, como bermudas, y vestidos femeninos, los cuales vende a crédito de lunes a domingos desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Neiber compra las materias primas e inumos, en almacenes especializados, donde obtiene precios competitivos de acuerdo con el volumen de sus compras. Sus principales clientes son referídos por familiares y amigos y negocios que lo solicitan sus vendedores. Sus metas relacionadas con el negocio están relacionadas, con el montaje de una infraestructura que mejore sus tiempos productivos , pues tiene como propósito, terminar de adecuar el apartamento donde habita, para aumentar su bienestar. Enla actualidad está alicando a un credikiva, primer finacimeint que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas, hilos, boltones, con los que fabricará ropa. Con este crédito incrementara la producción y sus ventas y esto es justamente lo que hace de su credikiva su mejor inversión.
texts.en: Neiber has liked the art of tailoring since she was very young. For this reason, she began her early experience at the age of 14, and later, to set up her own business, she studied in the National Apprenticeship Service, a technical school in Colombia that is supported by the national government, where she perfected her techniques and developed a more effective process. Now married, she works together with her husband in making uniforms and clothing in general, such as shorts and women's clothing, which she sells on credit from Monday to Sunday from 8 in the morning to 6 in the evening. Neiber buys her basic materials and supplies in specialized stores, where she obtains competitive prices according to the volume of her purchases. Her principal customers are referred by relatives, friends, and businesses whose salespeople ask for her. Her goals related to the business include setting up an infrastructure to improve her productive time, since she intends to finish adapting the apartment where she lives to increase her well-being. At this time she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy fabrics, threads, and buttons to make clothing. With this loan, she will increase her production and her sales, and this is exactly what makes her Kiva loan her best investment.

loans.use: to buy basic materials and supplies, such as fabrics, spools of thread, and buttons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's school fees and other study expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Binita

texts.en:
Binita is 30 years old. She is married and has one two year old child. In 2008, she established her agriculture business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seed and fertilizer. In the future, Binita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seed and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 45 years old. She is married and has four children, aged 27, 24, 21 and 18. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores called pasals are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Champa

texts.en:
Champa is 59 years old. She is married and has three children, aged 40, 38 and 30. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Champa plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

 In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores called pasals are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en: Mira is 35 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 18 and 15. Many years ago, she established her tailoring business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Mira plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurt a surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Gombojav

texts.en:
Gombojav is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ger, traditional nomadic tent, in Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his wife Naranchimeg and have been working at a local shoe manufacturing company for over a decade. His two children attend local primary school and kindergarten.

Gombojav has been working at local company with his wife for over 11 years and has a lot of experience. He recently purchased his very first at home machine and started manufacturing traditional shoes and boots by client's orders. He is now planning to purchase an extra machine for his wife to increase their productivity while they are still employed by the local company. He is now requesting a loan of 3,050,000 MNT to purchase shoe sewing equipment to his wife and increase their family income. He is well-experienced, open-minded and hardworking man.

loans.use: to purchase shoe sewing equipment for his wife and increase their family income.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat is 55 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling Khmer noodles for more than 10 years, earning approximately $15 per day. Her children are employed. They earn about $10 daily. 

To improve her family’s finances, Phat is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase ice cream containers for her son to sell ice cream. This money will help her son run an additional business and generate more income. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her house's condition.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream containers for her son to sell ice cream.

loans.name: Gulsaira

texts.en:
Mrs. Gulsaira is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children, under age 6, in their parents' small house in Bayan-Ulggi province, Mongolia. Her husband, Hurmethan, is unemployed and stays home taking care of their family. Her older child attends local primary school and the younger children stay home. 

Gulsaira has been crafting embroidery and selling it to local residents and tourists since she was 18. Her mother was very talented and taught her everything. She is now planning to build their own family house and is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase construction and insulation materials to build a good warm house, with less heat loss, to stay comfortable and warm during Mongolia's harsh and cold winter. She is hardworking, strong and an open-minded woman.

loans.use: to purchase construction and insulation materials to build a good warm house, with less heat loss, to stay comfortable and warm during Mongolia's harsh and cold winter

loans.name: Humar

texts.en:
Mr.Humar is 32 years old and lives with his wife and a daughter in a small house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and stays home taking care of the family; his daughter goes to the local primary school. 

Humar graduated from college.  Since job openings in Bayan-Ulgii are very rare and people tend to be self-employed with their own small businesses, he started his taxi service business in town. He has wanted to replace his car for a long time now but cannot afford to do so.  He is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase spare parts to maintain his car and continue his business with no sudden stops.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain his car and continue his business with no sudden stops

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan is a 37-year-old widow who lives with her daughter in an apartment in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her daughter moved in recently but she works at local company and takes care of herself. 

Jargalsaihan has been working as tailor for years and started her own business of a tailoring service at home in 1995 in a rental workplace. Her workplace is not connected to the central heating grid and she is now requesting 600,000 MNT to purchase lower electricity consuming heating equipment at her workplace in order to avoid burning coal or other fuel which contributes to air pollution. She is a hardworking, well-behaved, and strong woman.

loans.use: to purchase lower electricity consuming heating equipment at her workplace in order to avoid burning coal or other fuel which contributes to air pollution.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of planks and other supplies

loans.name: Bunthoern

texts.en:
Bunthoern is a 48-year-old married man with 3 children who resides in Kampong Chnnang Province, Cambodia.  He has been running a motor taxi service for more than ten years, earning approximately $10 per day.  His wife, who joins him in the picture, sells fruit at the market.  She makes an income of $8 each day.  

Since the present motorbike is old, Bunthoern is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike to run the taxi service.  This purchase will help him to attract more customers and earn more income for the family.  In the future, he would like to rebuild his house and help his children earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for a taxi service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory and tools to produce embroidered bedding and Ger decorations.

loans.name: Nasanjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Nasanjargal is 47 years old and lives alone in a ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Gurvan-Tes soum of Umnugovi province, Mongolia. Her only son is married and lives separately. 
Nasanjargal has been working at a local mining company as a chef and during her time off she runs a small grocery store to increase her income. The company she works for is located a little bit far from soum center and the company staff and some residents live there and her store is the only small store in the area. She covers her expenses and also supports her son and his family. She is a hardworking, welcoming and open person who is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase inventories for her store and serve local residents.

loans.use: to purchase inventories for her store and serve local residents

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Ek is a 53-year-old married woman and mother of seven children. She lives with her family in her own home in Baray district, Kampong Thom province. Farming is a popular business in her area, and she has been engaged in this for more than 30 years now. She has around two hectares of farmland, on which she grows and harvests rice and cassavas to sell.

Ek would like to help her son, who is a motor taxi driver, to further improve his business by purchasing a trailer to attach with the motorcycle “Motor Remork in Khmer” to continually provide his service. Due to the lack of capital, she has applied for a loan in the sum of KHR 1,500,000 from HKL and Kiva lenders to buy a trailer for her son. This loan will enable her son to go ahead in his current business and boost more income to satisfy their basic living needs.

loans.use: to buy a trailer for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase smaller tools and equipment to officially start his business.

loans.name: Jadi

texts.en: Mr. Musera is doing well in his welding business as well as in repaying his business loan. He has borrowed another loan to pay college fees for his son. He repaid his previous loan and his son is fairing well in school. Mr. Musera is happy to see his children receive a good education up to the level they desire.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia, department of Business Administration. Here is her story:
“This year I enrolled at the American University of Central Asia, because it is the right path and direction for my life. I heard many interesting things about this university from my friends. Among them are several characteristics of this university that I could not ignore. As I understood, AUCA encourages students to study independently and gives leadership and presentation skills, teaches proper time management, encourages creativity, and gives opportunity to students to study abroad and to discover the world of knowledge with its rich educational resources. I believe that all of the above develops me as a good researcher and leader. The major of Business Administration is the path that will lead me toward the realization of my dream. 
AUCA gives an opportunity of financial support to all its students with a Kiva loan. I would like to take an opportunity and apply for financial support. It will enable me to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Kombinat

texts.en:
Mr. Kombinat is a 67-year-old man who lives with his wife, 2 children, and his older son's family in their house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia.  His wife, Nurhiya, is 60 years old and stays at home, enjoying her retirement.  His son, Erlan, has married and works at a local construction company as an assistant worker during the summers.  His daughter-in-law works at a local market cafeteria.  His grandchildren and younger daughter are local primary school students. 

Kombinat has been running a small animal pelt and raw material retail business for years at the local market.  He is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT.  This will be used to purchase a secondhand car for his son to start his taxi service business in town, in order to earn a stable income. The Kombinat family members are hardworking, enthusiastic and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand car for a taxi service.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 43 years old from Nandarasi in Nyandarua South. He is married and he and his wife have three children aged between 15 years and 3 years old.

Nelson has been a farmer for the last 8 years now. He has applied for his third loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him buy seedlings and fertilizer to use on his farm.The fertilizers will help boost the fertility of his farm and hence increase farm yields.

He hopes to expand his farm in the near future by introducing new crops for planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings to use on his farm

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 61 years old from Nakuru. She is married to Boniface and they do not have any children.

For the last 35 years, she has been carrying out farming activities where she grows crops like maize, wheat, potatoes and beans. She would like to buy some fertilizer and potato tubers to plant. To do this, she has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from Kadet Ltd.

Her monthly income right now is 10,000 KES and she plans to use profits from her expanded business to buy a dairy cow. She hopes for a blessed future for her business and family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and some potato tubers to plant

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a single mother of two children aged 14 and 12 years old. Nancy is 44 years old from Nakuru.

She is a food vendor, a business she has operated for the last seven years. She sells foodstuff like fried potatoes, fruits, vegetables and boiled maize and beans, commonly called 'githeri' which is a mixture of beans and maize. Nancy would like to buy additional stock of the items that she sells in large quantities so as to be able to serve more customers. To enable her do that she has applied for her second loan of KES 10,000 from Kadet Ltd.

Her monthly income right now is KES 15,000 and she intends to use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children, pay her loan back to Kadet Ltd and to expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams is to spend her future in prosperity and to educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: To buy stocks of potatoes, cooking fat, maize, beans and fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Lhagvasuren is a 50-year-old man who lives with his wife in a Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Uvs Province, Mongolia.  His wife, Ulambayar, stays home and takes care of him.  His children are married and live apart.

Lhagvasuren has been providing transportation services in town since 1999.  He has started providing a taxi service business in last few years.  He has already built his regular client base and has pleased his clients with reliable services.  He has been covering his car during winter with an insulated cover for years and is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials to build a garage.  This will increase his car's lifetime.  He is hardworking and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase construction material to build a garage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a secondhand car.

loans.name: Chege

texts.en:
Chege is 56 years from Nakuru. He is married to Nancy and they are blessed with five children aged 16, 14, 12, 10 and 8 years old.

He is a dairy farmer, a business he has been running for the last 13 years. Chege needs some money to buy animal feed and a heifer, and to enable him to do this he has applied for his second loan of KES 40,000 from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now from his business is KES 10,000, and he hopes to use the anticipated profits from his business to pay his loan back to Kadet Ltd and to educate his children who are all in school.

His hopes and dreams for his business and family is to be prosperous and successful.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and a heifer

loans.name: Et

texts.en:
Et is 40 years old and married with four children, one of whom works in a garment factory and the rest of whom depend on her income.  Et lives with her family in a rural village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham Province.  Et has been engaged in agriculture to provide enough food for the family.  She primarily cultivates rice on their land, alongside her husband, and sells it at the harvest season.  Farming is the most important source of income for the family.  Despite her hardships, she aims to provide enough for their basic needs and for the education of her children.

HKL offers a special interest rate for a water loan.  As a result, Et is delighted and encouraged to take out this loan to build a latrine, because she wants to improve her general living conditions.  She is now borrowing a loan of 250 US dollars from HKL and Kiva lenders.  By means of this bathroom, her family can access sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.
