She thanks lenders for their generosity in providing the loan, through its partners, to help low-income families around the world.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 46 years old, married, and supports eight members of her family. She runs a cereals business in Kunyat, located at the outskirts of Kapsabet town, and served by KADET Kapsabet office. This has been her income generating business for the last five years, and she gets an average monthly income of KES 12,000.

She plans to use the amount of KES 60,000 borrowed to purchase additional stocks for her cereals business. Her dream is to educate her children and improve her family's the standards of living.

loans.use: Dinah will use this loan to add more stocks in her cereals business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 34 years old, married, and supports four members of her family. She has a retail business in Kapsabet town, served by KADET Kapsabet office. This has been her income generating business for the last two years, and she gets an average monthly income of KES 32,000. 

She plans to use the amount borrowed to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar in stock for resale. Her dream is to start a boutique and a salon as a way of expanding her businesses in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar for resale

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 29 years old, married, and supports four members of her family. She sells cereals in Chemundu, a location served by KADET Kapsabet office. This has been her income generating business for the last eight years. Irene gets an average monthly income of KES 24,000.

She plans to use the amount borrowed to expand her business and venture into selling milk and keeping poultry. Her dream is to educate her children and own dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for resale, and venture into selling milk and keeping poultry.

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Khut, aged 31, has a common-law relationship with her husband, who works as a taxi driver in Phnom Penh. This couple has been blessed with two children. Khut is a butcher and works selling pork and fish from a rented booth in a village market in Kampong Cham. She enjoys doing her business because she likes to communicate with her customers. The business earns her a moderate profit of $5.00 per day. She has been in this business for nearly five years. 

Khut aims to keep improving her general living conditions and provide her family members with a comfortable lifestyle. With the loan requested from Kiva lenders, she will buy a motorcycle to support them in their daily needs. Khut is a very hardworking woman who feels happy for the opportunity being provided since this will allow them to have their own motorcycle and reduce some expenses on taxi fees.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to support them in their daily needs.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly is 47 years old, married, and supports four members of her family. Her spouse, Philip, helps in generating additional income for the family by carrying out tea farming. 

Selly runs a hotel(restaurant) in Chemundu, a location served by KADET Kapsabet office. This has been her income generating business for the last eight years, getting an average monthly income of KES 20,000.

Selly plans to use the amount borrowed to expand her hotel business by getting additional flour, vegetables, and rice in large quantities for making food to sell to her daily customers. Her dream is to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her hotel (restaurant) business by getting additional flour, vegetables, and rice in large quantities.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 56 years old, from Nakuru. He is married to Mary, who is a farmer, and they are blessed with four children aged 32, 29, 26 and 20 years old.

Samuel has been in the farming sector for the last 13 years and to enable him buy some goats for rearing, he has applied for his third loan of KES 20,000 from Kadet Ltd. His monthly income right now from the sales of farm produce like green bananas, potatoes, kale and milk is KES 10,000.

He intends to use the profits from his expanded business to buy a dairy cow. He hopes to buy a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy some goats to rear

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 52 years old from Olkalou. He is married to Rachael, who assists him with farm work, and they are blessed with six children, ages 26, 24, 22, 20, 17 and 8 years old.

Thomas is a known farmer in his village, who grows crops, such as wheat, maize, beans, and potatoes for sale. He also plants trees for timber production, and at the same time keeps dairy cows for milk production. To increase milk supplies for maximum profits, Thomas has applied for his fourth loan of KES 50,000 from Kadet Ltd., which he intends to use in buying a dairy cow.

Right now, his monthly income from his business is KES 25,000, and his plan is to use the profits realized from his expanded business to pay his loan back to Kadet Ltd. and construct some rental houses on a plot he owns.

He hope for a brighter future for both his business and family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for production and sale of milk in the neighborhood.

loans.name: Kusayini

texts.en:
Kusayini is a married man, aged 36 with four children. He lives on the outskirts of Kyotera town with his family. His children are ten, eight, five and one years. He is a farmer who deals in agriculture, specifically coffee and he has been doing this business since 2007. He supplements his income with produce which he harvests seasonally.

Kusayini started this business in order to earn a living, and he has acquired this loan facility so that he can buy manure and pesticides for his coffee plantation. He says he sells his agricultural products to traders from city. His hope is to be the leading supplier of coffee in his area. The challenges he faces are a of lack of limited capital and unpredictable changes which destroys crops. He describes himself as hardworking and honest man and asks lenders to reduce interest rates.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
Luz es una joven de 22 años,  con un nivel académico hasta séptimo grado de estudio, está acompañada;  el esposo se dedica al comercio tiene una tienda frente al parque, desde hace 8 años. Han procreado un hijo de 4 años.

Luz, apoya al esposo en el negocio, pero ella quiere apoyarlo en instalar  una venta de antojitos frente a la tienda por las tardes;  ya que está enfrente de un parque y es visitado por muchos turistas,  entonces ella quiere instalar una venta de antojitos ya sean pupusas ,yuca frita y pasteles cosas que las personas buscan. Este negocio queda a 8 cuadras de la casa, la tienda la cierran a las 9 de la noche, ya cuando en el parque se han ido las personas.


Con el préstamo solicitado en fundación Campo, comprara una plancha para hacer pupusas y las preparaciones para preparar la yuca frita y los pasteles;  este negocio les mejorara en el aspecto, que le ayudara  a su esposo en llevar el sostén de la casa y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos y así tendrán más ingresos.

Los mayores sueños, es poder tener una tienda más grande  y que su venta sea del agrado de los turistas.
texts.en:
Luz is a young 22-year-old woman who studied until the 7th grade. She has a partner. Her spouse, who works as a merchant, has had a store in front of the park for eight years. They have a 4-year-old son together.

Luz already supports her husband in his business, but she wants to support him by setting up a snack stand in front of the store during the afternoons. A lot of tourists frequent the shop, given its location in front of the park. For this reason, she wants to put in a snack stand to sell things that people are looking for, like pupusas, fried yuca and pastries. This business is eight blocks away from her house. The shop closes at 9pm, when all the people have left the park.

With the loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo, Luz will buy a grill to make pupusas. She will also purchase the items needed to make fried yuca and pastries. This will improve the appearance of the business, which will help Luz's husband to support the household and to give a better life to their children. They will also have more earnings.

Luz's dream is to be able to have a bigger store, and that her sales will be pleasing to tourists.

loans.use: to buy a grill to make pupusas, and to purchase the items needed to make fried yuca and pastries.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Jargal is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a small house in Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband, Olziisaihan, is 40 years old. He is currently unemployed and works part-time here and there. Her daughter, Onorzul, is 21 and studies at university, and her son, Onobold, is 16 and a senior student at a local secondary school. 

Jargal has been providing a tailoring service business in town for the last seven years in a rental place. She is well-known for her qualified and friendly service. She recently has received an order from local clients and needs to meet the order on time in order to make it happen. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tughrik) to purchase inventory to meet the order on time with good quality to please her clients. 

She is a hardworking, talented and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to meet her order on time and with good quality to please her clients

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en:
Thuong is 31 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about $5 daily. In order to improve her family’s finance, Thuong is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a tricycle for her husband to run a new business of selling porridge in front of the garment factory. With this purchase, she hopes her husband can earn more income for the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a tricycle for her husband to run a new business of selling porridge.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old from Kitiri, Nyandarua. He is married, and together with his wife, they have five children who are between 22 and 10 years old.

John is a farmer, and has been in it for many years. He has applied for his fifth loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use in his farm.

He hopes to expand his farm in the near future, and improve his family's standards of living.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a married man, aged 48 with ten children. He lives in a rural setting with his family. His children are 22, 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, 10, 8, 6 and 4 years. Godfrey is a farmer who deals in agriculture, specifically with growing passion fruits. He has been in his business since 1990, and he has managed to pay tuition and provide food and materials to his family.

He supplements his family income with brewing, where he makes waragi, the local alcohol. He started these businesses in order to earn a living and he sells his products to traders from Kampala. Godrey has acquired this loan so that he can pay the balance of his daughter`s tuition so that she is able to sit for her exams.

His greatest dream is to educate all of his children to university level.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his daughter at university.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man aged forty-eight years old with five children, three of whom attend different schools in Nakatoogo. He lives in Nakatoogo and he is a farmer who deals in pineapple growing and timber selling as his side income.
He works six days a week and 10 hours per day and he says he has been growing pineapples since 2012 and timber selling since 2000.
He started the business in order to increase his income and he acquired the loan to buy pesticides and herbicides for his pineapple business. He hopes this will help to guard his pineapples from diseases and the output will therefore be high. He sells his products to traders from Kyotera and those in the village.
His dream is to be the leading supplier of pineapple in the region, however he experiences a problem of price fluctuation of herbicides and lack of enough causal labor.
He describes himself as a hardworking and honest man and encourages lenders to continue helping farmers.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and herbicides

loans.name: Nurjamal

texts.ru: Нуржамал 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Нуржамал - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нуржамал занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нуржамал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 5 овец, а также имеет 0,87 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает рис и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нуржамал обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нуржамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nurjamal is 38, married, and raising 5 kids together with her husband.  She has the equivalent of a high-school education and raises livestock for a living, having started 20 years ago with 5,000 somoni worth of animals. Thanks to her persistent efforts, she currently has 2 dairy cows, 5 sheep, and a 0.87 hectare plot of land for growing corn and rice every year, while her monthly income is nearly 5,000 somoni. To further develop her farm, Kanymkul is seeking a loan of 50,000 somoni from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy sheep. She plans on using the extra money that the loan will allow her to make to continue to buy more livestock.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for making tamales, pastries, and bread to sell, since people ask her when she is going to make them so they can buy them

loans.name: Aderlin Yesenia

texts.es:
Aderlin es una joven de 18 años de edad, la cual vive en la ciudad de Ica. Aderlin para poder tener ingresos y poder salir adelante trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola, Aderlin cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable.

Aderlin esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales para ´poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda y poder mejorar su calidad de vida, así podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Aderlin is a young woman of eighteen years of age. She lives in the city of Ica. Aderlin works as a labourer on a farm in order to earn money and to be able to get ahead. Aderlin thinks that she is doing well in her job because she is responsible.

Aderlin is grateful to Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy materials for making improvements to her home and improve her quality of life. She will thereby be able to continue fighting to make her big dream of getting a degree at university a reality.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is from the village of Ghaniri. She is 44 years old and married with two children. The only source of income for the family is a small monthly salary earned by Nino’s husband who works at the local cattle farm.
Nino and her family members live below the poverty line and get a small monthly social assistance from the local government. It’s often difficult for the family to cover feeding costs that is why Nino decided to purchase a milk cow and start a dairy business. Nino will produce cheese for selling as well as family consumption. This loan will be a great support for Nino’s family, as it will generate income. Nino thanks you for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start producing cheese

loans.name: Tajikan

texts.ru: Тажикан 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Тажикан - высшее образование, работает директором местной школы. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Тажикан занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Тажикан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 25 овец. Ежемесячный доход Тажикан составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тажикан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров с дальнейшим откормом и перепродажей. Доходы от кредита Тажикан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Tajikan is 43 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Tajikan has a higher education and works as a principal at a local school. To provide additional income for her family, Tajikan is involved in animal husbandry, having started 13 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Tajikan's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows and 25 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Tajikan requested a loan in the amount of 110,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows to fatten up and resell. Tajikan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Gulsan

texts.ru: Гульсан 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Гульсан - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гульсан занимается животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульсан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 бычок, 40 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульсан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульсан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Gulsan is 42 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Gulsan has a secondary-specialized education. To provide the primary income for her family, Gulsan is involved in animal husbandry, having started 17 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulsan's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 1 bull and 40 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 13,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Gulsan requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy calves in order to increase livestock headcount. Gulsan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to continue educating her children.

loans.use: to buy calves in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индире 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Индиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Индира занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Индиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец, а также имеет 3,11 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Индира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Индира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Indira is 32 years old, married and raising two children together with her husband. Indira has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, Indira is involved in animal husbandry, having started 12 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Indira's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 10 sheep and 3.11 hectares of land, where she annually grows beans. The monthly income amounts to 5,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Indira requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy calves in order to increase livestock headcount. Indira plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy calves in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Sonunbubu

texts.ru: Сонунбубу 67 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитала четверых  детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Сонунбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Сонунбубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сонунбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец, а также имеет 2,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль и  картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сонунбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сонунбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Sonunbubu is 67 years old, a widow, raised four children by herself after her husband's death and also runs her own business. Sonunbubu has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, Sonunbubu is involved in animal husbandry, having started 13 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Sonunbubu's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 10 sheep and also 2.0 hectares of land, where she annually grows beans and potatoes. The monthly income amounts to 5,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Sonunbubu requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy calves in order to increase livestock headcount. Sonunbubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: buy calves in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Фарогат 47-летняя вдова, проживающая на севере страны, в городе Худжанд. Ее муж погиб давно и она одна воспитывает свою единственную дочь, которая в данное время учится в школе. Чтобы обеспечивать семью, Фарогат уже несколько лет у себя дома занимается выращиванием скота. У нее много свободного времени и она решила начать еще один бизнес, которым будет заниматься дома. Фарогат очень вкусно печет торты и другие кондитерские изделия. Она хочет на этом построить свой бизнес. Для реализации задуманного плана, она просит кредит. На сумму кредита Фарогат хочет купить большую духовку и другие принадлежности для выпекания кондитерских изделий. Она уже договорилась с продавцами местных магазинов и будет поставлять им свои готовые торты и другие кондитерские изделия, а также она будет печь их по индивидуальным заказам. Фарогат настроена на успех и ожидает поддержки!
texts.en: Farogat is a 47 year-old widow living in the north of the country, in the city of Khujand.  Her husband died a long time ago and she has been raising her only daughter, who currently attends a school.  In order to provide for the family, Farogat has been growing livestock at home for several years.  She has a lot of free time and decided to start another business that she will run at home.  Farogat bakes very tasty cakes and other baked goods.  She wants to build her business on this.  To realize her plan, she is requesting this loan.  Farogat wants to use this loan to purchase a large oven and other accessories for baking confectionary goods.  She already reached agreements with sellers at local stores and will supply them with her cakes and other confectionary goods, and will also bake them for individual orders.  Farogat is set for success and awaits support!

loans.use: to purchase a large oven and other accessories for baking confectionary goods

loans.name: Islomhodja

texts.ru:
Исломходжа является предпринимателем в течении 5 лет. Он торгует на рынке головным убором. В настоящее время он хочет закупить товар так как начинается сезон головных уборов.
Он сумел создать небольшой магазин в центре города, где продает шапки и очки. На этот бизнес, у него не хватает денег для расширения товара оборота.

В связи с финансовыми трудностями , Исломходжа подал заявку на получение кредита. После получения кредита, он  снабдит свою лавку различными товарами, которые пользуются большим спросом его клиенты, и тем самым увеличить его продажи.

Его будущий план, преобразить свой магазин  в большой, и увеличив тем самым свой оборот и капитал. Таким образом Исломходжа    сможет поддержать свою  семью и улучшить условия жизни.
texts.en: Islomhodja has been an entrepreneur for 5 years.  He sells hats at a market.  At the present time, he wants to purchase merchandise because the hat season is starting.  He was able to have a small store in the city center, where he sells hats and glasses.  He does not have money to increase his goods turnover.  To deal with the financial difficulties, Islomhodja requested a loan.  After obtaining the loan, he will supply his store with various goods that are in demand by his customers, and, thus, increase his sales.  His future plan is to transform his store into a bigger one, thus, increasing his turnover and capital.  This is how Islomhodja will support his family and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase hats

loans.name: Rosa Yanet

texts.es:
Rosa, opta por invertir más en su negocio de pupusas, comprara harina, carne, quesillo y variedad de bebidas, para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos, con el préstamo anterior ella adquirió la materia prima para trabajar un tiempo, en el cual su negocio creció, mejoro su economía y ha podido ir cancelando sus deudas.
Rosa sigue manteniendo el mismo núcleo familiar, brinda mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, todos están muy saludables.
texts.en:
Rosa wants to invest more in her pupusa business, so she will buy flour, meat, cheese and soft drinks in order to keep her customers satisfied.  She used the previous loan to buy supplies to be able to work for a period of time.  Her business grew, her economy improved and she was able to pay off some debts.

Rosa continues supporting the same family unit and is able to provide better living conditions.  Everyone is very healthy.

loans.use: To buy flour, meat, cheese and soft drinks.

loans.name: Bill

texts.es: Bill, de 30 años de edad, es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres y sus 03 hermanos menores. El trabajo que realiza Bill es la elaboración de panes de la mejor calidad, para  lo cual cuenta con un espacio en la casa de sus padres, donde tiene los implementos necesarios como un horno moderno rotativo, amasadora y demás utensilios.  Lleva en ésta actividad más de 04 años, tiempo con el cual ha logrado hacerse de una clientela fiel por el buen sabor de sus panes, cuanta con el apoyo de un maestro panadero y dos ayudantes para la elaboración de los panes  y también el reparto por las bodegas  de la zona. Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda que tiene sus productos y las ganancias que le deja. Le gusta su trabajo pues tiene la idea de realizarse como un empresario emprendedor, dar trabajo a otras personas y así ayudar con el desarrollo de su localidad. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el préstamo de 800 nuevos soles, comprará insumos para la panificación  como harina por saco, mantequilla, azúcar y otros,  así podrá disminuir costos y mejorar sus márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Bill, 30, is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents and three younger siblings.  Bill is in the bakery business and makes high quality breads.  He works at home and has the necessary tools such as a modern rotary oven, dough maker and other utensils.  He has been in business for over four years and during that time has established a loyal customer base because of the good flavor of his bread.  He has the help of a master baker and two assistants to make the bread and deliver them to stores in the area.

He believes the business is profitable because of the demand for his products and the profits he makes.  He enjoys his work and wants to become a business owner and employ other people to help develop his community.  

This is his fifth Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial support he receives in order to prosper.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time.  He will use the 800 PEN loan to buy bakery supplies such as sacks of flour, butter, sugar and other supplies.  This will allow him to lower costs and improve profit margins.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter, sugar and other supplies.

loans.name: Kathy Yamileth

texts.es: Kathy, tiene 26 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Anteriormente trabajaba en una maquila y hace un año decidió vender ropa como faldas, shorts, jeans, blusas, camisetas, ropa para niños, artículos plásticos y achinería. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y cuenta con buenas clientela. El Prestamo que solicita es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más ropa como faldas, blusas, jeans, short etc.para la venta en esta temporada. Con las ganancias que obtenga piensa remodelar el local del negocio construyendo con paredes de cemento, y poder ofrecer un mejor ambiente y servicio a sus clientes. El propósito es hacer crecer el negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Kathy, 26, is married and has two children.  She lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula.  She used to work at a factory but a year ago decided to sell clothing such as skirts, shorts, jeans, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothing, plastic products and trinkets.  She works from home and has a good customer base.

The loan she is requesting is for 5,000 HNL and she plans to use it to buy more clothing such as skirts, blouses, jeans, shorts, etc. for the upcoming season.  With the profits she earns she will renovate her business and build cement walls.  This is so she can offer a better atmosphere to her customers.  She wants to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothing such as skirts, blouses, jeans, shorts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Dilcia Marilu

texts.es:
Dilcia es una joven muy trabajadora de 32 años de edad, casada, su grado de educación es  primaria completa, madre de 3 hijos menores de edad y uno de ellos está cursando la primaria; Ella vive en su hogar con sus 3 hijos y su esposo.
Dilcia desde hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, ella aprendió de sus padres desde que estaba niña ellos se dedican a este rubro, por lo que ella y su esposo tienen mucha experiencia en esta actividad. El terreno donde ellos cultivan lo compraron con mucho esfuerzo, está ubicado a 1 km de su casa de habitación por lo que caminan 8 minutos para llegar a su finca, luego ellos comienzan su labor de abonar y limpiar sus cultivos, en esta actividad todos los miembros del hogar colaboran y se esfuerzan para no pagar mucho dinero en mano de obra ya que no cuentan con los recursos económicos para hacerlo. Dilcia espera obtener una excelente cosecha ya que de esto depende la economía de su hogar, su producción la venden a los intermediarios que llegan a la localidad.
Por lo que necesita financiamiento para la compra de abono, foliares, mano de obra y 550 plantas de café para sembrar parte de su finca que no está cultivada porque no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para hacerlo. 
Dilcia sueña en un futuro ampliar su  finca, para obtener una mayor producción y mejorar sus ingresos para pagar los estudios de sus hijos una vez que crezcan, desea que ellos tengan mejores oportunidades que la que las que tuvo ella. Piensa que sus planes los lograran con el financiamiento que está solicitando, aprovechara al máximo esos recursos y los invertirá en su finca que es la única fuente de trabajo que genera ingresos en su hogar.
texts.en:
Dilcia is a hard-working young woman, aged 32, who has a complete elementary education.  She is married and has three minor children, one of whom attends school. She lives with her threee children and her husband.

For five years Dilcia has been involved in agriculture, specifically coffee growing.  She learned the trade from her parents when she was a little girl, so she and her husband have much experience in the sector.  They bought the cropland they have through a lot of hard work and it is located one kilometer from their house, so it is an 8-minute walk to get to the plantation.  They begin their work by cleaning and fertilizing the fields.  Everyone in the family collaborates so as not to have to pay much to hire workers, which is very expensive.  Dilcia hopes to obtain an excellent harvest because her household economy depends on it.  She sells her crop to dealers in the area. 

She is in need of a loan to buy fertilizer, plant treatment, and hire workers, and also buy 550 coffee plants to finish planting the rest of the plantation.

In the future, dilcia wants to expand her plantation to increase production and improve her income.  She wants to be able to give her children an education when they grow up so they will have better opportunities than she had.  She believes she can carry out her plans with the loan she is requesting.  She will take full advantage of the resources and invest them in the plantation which is her household's only source of income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and coffee plants.

loans.name: Yokubjon

texts.ru:
Ёкубжон мужчина, в возрасте 27 лет. Он женат, имеет одного ребенка и живет в сельской местности Дж. Расуловского района. Ёкубжон очень успешный и целеустремленный предприниматель, занимается купля продажей и откармливанием крупно рогатого скота. Откармливание КРС был их традиционный, семейный бизнес т. е его предки занимались этим видом бизнеса.
 Кроме этого бизнеса в свободное время Ёкубчон  работает в частных стройках, чтобы был дополнительный доход. Жена работает в Дехканском хозяйстве получает очень низкую заработную плату. Ёкубжон знает что в будущем ему придется купить жилище, и расходы на детей будут увеличиваться. Поэтому Ёкубжон старается накопить денежные средства по больше, чтобы в будущем не было проблем с деньгами.  Он мечтает купить дом  и дать  детям достойное образование. Для этого Ёкубчон хочет расширить свой бизнес по откорму скота. На полученный кредит он планирует купить скот.
texts.en:
Yokubjon is a 27-year-old man. He is married, has a child, and lives in a rural area of the J. Rasulov region of Tajikistan. Yokubjon is a very successful and motivated entrepreneur who is engaged in buying, fattening and reselling cattle - his family's traditional occupation. In addition to running his own business, Yokubjon works at private construction sites in his spare time in order to supplement his income. His wife works at an orchard farm and earns a very low salary.

Yokubjon knows that in the near future he will need to buy a home, and that the family's spending on their children will keep going up. And so, Yokubjon is trying to save up some money now in order to avoid financial difficulties in the future. He dreams of buying a house and providing his children with quality education. To this end, Yokubjon would like to expand his cattle business. He plans to use this loan to buy additional cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Davlatkhuja

texts.ru: Давлатхуча хороший и опытный строитель. Ему 30 лет. Он живет с женой и шестилетним сыном в районе Дж.Руми. Его жена домохозяйка, а сын ходит в детский сад. Давлатхуча как глава семьи всегда заботится о благополучии семьи. Он зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги по строительству домов. Это единственный источник дохода их семьи. Давлатхуча занимается строительным делом в течение 7 лет и имеет одного помощника. Сейчас для продолжения своего дела Давлатхуча нуждается в сварочном аппарате. Чтобы купить данный аппарат, он обратился за кредитом.
texts.en: Davlatkhuja is a skilled and experienced builder. He is 30 years old and lives with his wife and their six-year-old son in the J. Rumy region of Tajikistan. Davlatkhuja's wife takes care of the household, while his son attends kindergarten. As the head of the family, Davlatkhuja is always concerned about everyone's well-being. He earns a living by constructing homes, and this represents the family's only source of income. He has been building homes for 7 years and currently employs one assistant. Presently, Davlatkhuja needs a welding apparatus for continued success of his business. He is requesting a loan to make this purchase.

loans.use: to purchase a welding apparatus

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 40-year-old married man; he lives in Jenin city with his small family. He has one daughter and son; they attend the secondary school. 

In 2007 Ahmad started his own business. He is farmer; he farms different kind of vegetables on his land. Some he sells to the local market, the rest he sells by going around to his neighbors' doors.

He asked Ryada for this loan to buy greenhouses and water pump. This will help him a lot to improve his business and take forward step in this field. 

Ahmad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy greenhouses and a water pump.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Doña Dominga, tiene 52 años de edad,  es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Hace 6 años que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz y baleadas (tortillas de harina rellenas con frijoles, queso, huevo y otros). Las tortillas de maíz las vende todos los días y las baleadas solo los fines de semana. El préstamo que  solicito es por 6,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de maíz, leña y bolsas plásticas para empacar las tortillas y vender. El préstamo le ayuda a tener dinero efectivo y comprar de contado los insumos que necesita. Su plan es ampliar más el local donde hace las tortillas.
texts.en:
Dominga is 52 years old and a single mother of two children. She lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula. For six years she has been making and selling corn tortillas and baleadas (flour tortillas stuffed with beans, cheese, eggs, etc.). She sells the corn tortillas every day and the baleadas only on weekends. 

She is requesting a loan of 6,000 HNL that she will use to buy corn, firewood, and plastic bags to pack the tortillas and sell them. This loan allows her to keep cash and to buy the necessary inputs cash. Her plan is to expand the place where she makes the tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and plastic bags in order to make and sell tortillas

loans.name: Noeline

texts.en:
Noeline is a single mother aged 31 with four children all attending different schools. She lives in Kyotera town and she has a retail shop. She also has a restaurant as a side business; she started her business in 2008.

She works 7 days a week and 14 hours per day and she started her business to earn a living and get money to pay school fees since she is a single mother. She acquired this loan to add stock to her retail shop. Her clients are residents of Kyotera.

Her dream is to build rooms to rent on her plot and the challenge she faces is lack of enough capital. She describes herself as a hardworking woman and encourages lenders to keep helping business people.

loans.use: To buy household stock items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 56 years old and is from Sakutiek which is on the outskirts of Naivasha town. He is married and they have children who are in school.

Daniel is a farmer and has been in it for many years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on his farm. Daniel is optimistic that his farm will do better after the loan. 

He hopes to expand his farm in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Al-Kram Group

texts.en:
This group, called Al-Kram, consists of six members who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 290,000 YER. 

Amal is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been selling food for two years. She is honest, trustworthy, and a hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead. She describes her biggest challenge as insufficient funds for improving her business. 

She requests a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy food to stock her business so as to be able to meet her customers' demands and to increase her profit. With this loan, she will earn a very good reputation, and will also be able to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy food to stock her business so as to be able to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is thirty two years old with a wife and four children. He lives in a rural area with his family. His children are nine, seven, five and three years respectively.

He is a businessman who deals in trading coffee and he has been doing it for thirteen years. He supplements his income with agriculture and he operates a small shop in his garage.

He started these businesses because of experience he had in them and this helped him to manage them easily. He has acquired this loan facility in order to buy more coffee to trade. He sells his products to traders from the city and fellow traders from around.

Richard hopes to be the leading supplier of coffee in their village but still has faces the challenge of delay of payments by his customers. He is hard working and honest.

loans.use: To buy coffee to trade.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase winter clothes to sell in her rental booth when seasonal clothing demand is high.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a married man aged 30 years with two children, one of whom attends school. He lives in Kisaayi and has a retail shop and does agriculture as a side income. He started his business in 2003.

He works 7 days a week and 18 hours per day and he started his business to increase his family income. He is acquiring this loan to purchase more stock for the retail business. His clients are the residents of Kisaayi and people from villages around Kisaayi.

His future hopes are to build rental accommodation in Kisaayi and to grow to become a wholesaler. The challenges he faces are delay of payments by customers who take items on credit and lack of enough capital.

He describes himself as a hardworking man and encourages lenders to keep helping business people since it will lead to the development of different areas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 37 years old from Nakuru. He is married to Seraphine who is a business lady and they are blessed with two children aged six and three years old.

He is in the transport sector where he operates a rickshaw, and this business has been in operation for the last five years. Isaac has applied for his first loan of KES 70,000 from KADET Ltd. which will be used to repair his rickshaw so as to be able to offer better services to his customers.

His monthly income right now is KES 15,000 and he intends to use profits from his expanded business to educate his children and pay back his loan to KADET Ltd.

He has dreams and hopes of building rental houses in the future on a plot he owns.

loans.use: To repair his rickshaw.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 38-year-old married man; he lives in Jenin city with his small family. He has one child who attends the primary school. 

One year ago Ghassan initiated a business raising chickens in his own yard in order to sell their meat in the local market. It is a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement. 

He asked Ryada for this loan to buy chicks in large quantities. This will increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family. 

Ghassan is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks in large quantities.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 27 years old from Naivasha and is married to Grace. They have a child who is a year and nine months old.

Charles has a poultry business that he has been doing for the past one year. He has applied for his first loan from KADET to enable him to buy more poultry to add to his stock. 

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more poultry to add to his stock.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 51 years old from Engineer, Nyandarua. He is married and together they have two children aged 16 years and five years.

Daniel is a tailor and has been in it for many years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy more clothing materials to add to his stock.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Meet Priscilla a 40-year-old farmer, who lives in the highlands of Kericho, where she has been involved in farming for 18 years. She has a five-acre farm where she does dairy farming and where she has four cows which produce 15 litres of milk per day. She plants maize, passion fruit, tomatoes and potatoes. Tomatoes and potatoes are grown for commercial use and she also has 20 poultry. She states that she enjoys farming very much but access to dairy feed is her biggest challenge.

Priscilla chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of the low interest it gives on their loans and the loan repayment has been made easier to clients. During Juhudi's micro-finance training session, Priscilla learned that in order to grow financially, she has to develop a savings culture. This loan will benefit her family by increasing the income base because by building cattle sheds the dairy cows will be well taken care of and thus produce more litres of milk.

She is looking forward to maintain the relationship with Juhudi and get more asset finances.

loans.use: To construct a dairy shed.

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.ru: Зайнаб трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1963 года. Зайнаб замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж Сафарали трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Зайнаб более 7 лет работает в центре по борьбе со СПИДом. Она умная и начитанная женщина. Зайнаб старается, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Ее дочь в этом году успешно окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Медицинский Колледж. Она мечтает стать в будущем хорошем медиком. Зайнаб должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zaynab is a hard-working woman. She was born in 1963. She is married and is raising 2 children. Zaynab has been working at an AIDS clinic for over 7 years while her husband Safarali is a migrant labourer in Russia. Zaynab is an intelligent and well-read person. She tries to do everything she can to provide post-secondary education to her children. This year, her daughter successfully graduated from high school and entered a medical college, with dreams of becoming a skilled medic. Zaynab needs to pay her daughter's tuition fees, to which end she is requesting this loan. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's college education

loans.name: Wa'el

texts.en:
Wa’el is 27 years old, he lives in Gaza.  He sells various goods like electronics and other household items. He has been involved in the retail business for many years, and it still needs a lot of improvement, so he is requesting a loan of $2,000 to purchase more goods, repair the store door and decorate.  

Wa’el is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more goods, repair the store door and decorate.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 36 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de comida con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia, Edgar trabaja alrededor de 11 horas al día y cree que le va bien porque tiene buena sazón y es amable con los clientes.

Edgar está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá comprar una cocina industrial y poder realizar mejoras en su local, como  pintado y arreglo de la electricidad, así podrá brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes y seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un local propio para su negocio”
texts.en:
Edgar is 36 years old. With a lot of effort he has managed to start his own business selling food. This gives him an income so that he can move his family forward. Edgar works around 11 hours a day and he believes that the business is going well because of his well-seasoned cooking and his kind way with clients.

Edgar is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help he will be able to buy an industrial kitchen and to make improvements to his food stall, such as painting and electrical instalments. That way he will be able to better serve his clients and continue working in order to make his dream come true: "to have his own place of business".

loans.use: to buy an industrial kitchen and to make improvements to his food stall

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 38 years old from Nyahururu; he is married to Monicah who assists him in farm work and they are blessed with two children aged 15 and 9 years old.

He is a farmer, a business he has been running for the last four years. He grows maize, potatoes, beans, kale and he also rears chicken, goats and cows. Simon feels that his family spends a lot of time going to get firewood and this could be spent instead on working on the farm in order to get better yields. This is the reason why he has applied for his fourth loan of KES 13,800 from KADET Ltd. which will be used to buy a gas cooker complete with a gas cylinder and a burner.

His monthly income from his farm right now is KES 28,000 and he intends to use profits from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay back his loan to KADET Ltd.

His hopes and dreams are for his family and business to be successful and productive.

loans.use: To buy a gas cooker so his family spends less time to collect firewood.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is a married man aged twenty-nine who has two children. He lives on the outskirts of Kyotera town with his family.

He is a business man who has a retail shop and he has been operating it for last eight years. Yasin also does agriculture, specifically banana growing, in order to supplement his income. Yasin works six days a week and each day he works for 14 hours. On Monday and Tuesday he works on the banana plantation and the rest of the days he works at the retail shop.

He started this business in order to earn a living after dropping out of school. He is acquiring this loan so that he can purchase more stock for his retail shop so that he can serve his customers by selling all their desired goods.

He says he sells goods to local people around his home area and he has hopes to expand his retail to the level of wholesale when he gets enough money.

His biggest challenges are delay of payments by his customers who take goods on credit and lack of enough capital to stock several goods at the same time.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in the retail shop.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 34 years old from Nakuru. He is married to Purity, who produces some additional income to the family, and they are blessed with two children aged seven and three years.

He is in the motorcycle transport industry, a business he has been running for the last five years, and to enable him to buy another motorcycle, he has applied for his second loan of KES 78,200 from Kadet Ltd.

Simon's monthly income right now is KES 8,000, and he intends to use profits realized from his expanded business to educate his children and to buy a rickshaw.

He hopes and dreams of a prosperous future for his business and family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him, aged 39, is married and mother to two school-aged children, both of whom are attending to school. She and her spouse cultivate their own land in Pursat province. They have been growing rice for almost 10 years, and earn a suitable income to feed and educate their children. Having been in this business for years, Him plans to develop her farming areas in order to be able to meet the increasing needs of her family more effectively.

Being responsible for the family, Him aims to provide enough nutrition with healthy living conditions to her family members. Therefore she would like to acquire a loan which will enable her to buy materials needed to build a latrine, buy latrine accessories and pay for labor costs. This loan will help promote their health, and lessen environmental deterioration. 

Him thanks lenders for distributing their funds in a program like Kiva via its partners, HKL to help low-income people gain access to sanitation and personal hygiene.

loans.use: to build a latrine, buy latrine accessories and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Fazliddin

texts.ru: Фазлиддин молодой и энергичный человек. Ему 24 года. Он является студентом Национального Университета Таджикистана. Фазлиддин учится  по специальности историка. После окончания университета он будет работать в музее, так как он имеет большой интерес к истории. Он тщательно изучает как мировую историю, так и историю таджикского народа. Фазлиддин еще не женат и живет с родителями. Он не из состоятельной семьи и поэтому у него нет возможности оплатить за учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Fazliddin is an energetic young man. He is 24 years old and is a student at Tajikistan National University. Fazliddin is studying to become an historian. After graduation, he will work at a museum to further pursue his love of history. He is diligently learning world history as well as the history of the Tajik people.

Fazliddin is still single and lives with his parents. His family is not rich, and so he is unable to pay his university tuition. Fazliddin is requesting this loan to pay for his education and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university education

loans.name: Ata Hussain

texts.en:
Ata Hussain is a very hardworking and honest person living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a responsible housewife and all of his children are students. Since 1988 he has been running a clothing shop, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Currently he needs to purchase clothing for the winter season for his shop but finds it difficult due to a lack of finances. Ata Hussain has requested a loan of 120,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase winter clothing for his clothing shop. He wishes to provide quality education for his children. 

He is very thankful to all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a very hard-working man from Nyahururu. He is 50 years old, married to Peris and they are blessed with three children aged 22, 18 and 12 years old.

He is a farmer who specializes in growing and selling of maize. Joseph has been running this business for the last five years. He uses human labour to shell corn from the cob and it is time-consuming and tiresome. As a result of this, he has decided to apply for his second loan of KES 33,500 from KADET Ltd. which will enable him buy a corn sheller i.e. the machine used for shelling/removing corn from the cob.

His monthly income right now is KES 20,000 and his plan is to use profits from his expanded business to pay back his loan to KADET Ltd. and to expand his farming activities.

He hopes for a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy a corn sheller: the machine used to remove corn from the cob.

loans.name: Al-Tathwq Group

texts.en:
This group, Al-Tathwq, consists of four ladies. They are from Aden, Yemen and they know each other very well as they have lived in the same neighborhood for a long time. All of their projects are home-based; however, they have many clients, mostly women.  

Nasma is 24 years old, married, and has a child. She is an affectionate member of this group and she is very happy because her business has improved little by little. She has been distributing mobile recharge cards and perfumes. She started the business to help her family with their children’s expenses and to have her own capital to cover any unexpected costs. 

She distributes her mobile recharge cards to call centers and she distributes her perfumes to cosmetic shops in order to earn additional profit. She loves her work and aspires to continue it. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to continue buying mobile recharge cards and perfumes that will help her to earn more profit from her business.

loans.use: to continue buying mobile recharge cards and perfumes that will help her to earn more profit from her business.

loans.name: Fowla Group

texts.en:
This group is called Fowla, which consists of three women. They live in Aden, Yemen. Jamila is a happy woman who treats everyone well because of her opportunities to get ahead. She, like many people, has had good times and bad ones and has gotten ahead despite whatever stands in her way. She is 52 years old, married and has children, most who are in school. She is worried about her house, so she applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.
 
With great strength and dedication, she has become a better person. She is grateful to remodel the inside of the house and thus make it more comfortable for her family. Jamila commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to remodel the inside of the house and thus make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Акбар родился в 1992 года. Он является студентом 4 курса Национального Университета Таджикистана. Акбар учится в факультете Финансы и кредит. Акбар учится успешно. Он активно участвует во всех общественных мероприятиях университета. Он после окончания университета мечтает работать в банке и сделать успешную карьеру. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Он не имеет денег, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Akbar was born in 1992. He is a fourth-year student in the Faculty of Finance and Credit at Tajik National University. Akbar is a successful student and also takes an active part in university's social events. After graduation, he dreams of working at a bank and building a successful career.

Akbar is not married and lives with his parents. He has no money to pay his university tuition and requesting this loan to pay for his education. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a married man, aged 23 and supporting two members of his family. He sells electronics in Tenges and has been in operation for a period of two years earning an income of KES 30,000 monthly.

He has borrowed his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd and intends to purchase additional electronics for his shop for resale. The profit he earns will be reserved as savings and purchase a plot.  

His dream is to succeed in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more electronics for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, aged 38, is married with four children aged 19, 17, 15 and 13 respectively. She helps her husband to pay tuition feesfor their three school-going children. She also has a dependent, a house-helper. 

Mary is a farmer and has a retail shop which she started in order to support her family. The business has been in existence since 1997. Mary has approached UGAFODE for another loan of UGX 1,500,000 after taking 500,000 and 1,000,000 respectively which have helped her advance in her business. She wants the money to pay tuition fees for their children, who are doing exams soon and she promises to pay back after the sale of the agricultural produce. 

Mary faces challenges like competition and inflation and her additional income from agriculture is too seasonal and unreliable.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en:
Nzingo is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past five years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge.Nzingo dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar and sweets for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 28 years old, married to Ann and together they are blessed with two children who are in school.

He is in a transport business in Naivasha which he has been running for three years with an average monthly income of KES 30,000. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to service his motor bike. With the anticipated profit from his expanded business, he plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, he hopes to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: To service the motor bike.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. Damaris dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase cakes, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cakes, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Magamed

texts.en:
Magamed is a 60-year-old married man. He lives in a small village of Marneuli district with his wife, son and daughter-in-law. Magamed works as a shepherd of his village and gets 400 GEL per month. His son works as a physical worker to generate income. The family lives in poverty as they have not got a stable income to cover their expenses. 

Magamed decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 3,000 GEL to purchase a cow and calves. With the received credit, the family will have a chance to start a husbandry business and produce dairy products to sell. The Start-up program will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and calves.

loans.name: Santos Del Carmen

texts.es:
Santos de 26 años, tiene educación media, esta soltera. Aún vive en casa de sus padres de ella, ya no estudia por la situación económica resultan  demasiado costoso sacar una carrera universitaria,  en casa de la cliente viven 5 personas, sus padres  que son comerciantes en pequeño y tres hermanos 2 de ellos estudian y uno más colabora en el negocio familiar que tienen.

  
Santos, es propietaria de un puesto de venta de juguetes para niños y niñas en el mismo local donde tiene el negocio sus padres,  ella se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 2 años, desde que salió de estudiar, ella ha buscado otra forma de poder trabajar; pero no lo ha conseguido es por eso que decidió dedicarse al comercio ella además de atender su negocio también colabora con el negocio de sus padres el trabajo le queda de distancia a 3 cuadras de sus casa, las cuales recorre en bicicleta sus horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día. 


El préstamo será utilizado, para la compra de mercadería parea mejorar la venta del negocio; comprara muñecos para niños y niñas, entre otros artículos que puedan mejorar las ventas. El préstamo vendrá a mejorar los ingresos, debido a que en la época de navidad es cuando más se vende y por eso quiere aprovechar la  oportunidad  para mejorar  sus insumos. Y así podrá cubrir la demanda que tiene de venta.   

Ella desea, constituir su propio negocio en su propio local,  su sueño es convertirme en una gran empresaria donde pueda crecer no solo en este negocio, si no poner otros los cuales puedan ayudar  a las personas y colaborar de mejor manera con sus padres que tanto le han ayudado. 

Para su futuro le gustaría seguir estudiando y graduarse de licenciada. La ganancia la utilizara en la compra de más insumos, para ampliar su negocio y si es posible poner otro puesto en el municipio, para tener una mejor venta.
texts.en:
Santos is 26 years old and has completed middle school. She is single and still lives in her parents' house. She isn't studying any more because her economic situation does not allow her to pursue a university degree. There are five persons living together with her: her parents who are merchants and three siblings, whereof two are studying and one is helping out with the family business.

Santos owns a stall where she sells toys for boys and girls, which is located in the same place where her parents have their business. She has been running this business for two years since she left school. She has been looking for another job, but since she couldn't find one she decided to start working in commerce. Apart from managing her own business she also helps out with that of her parents, which is located three blocks from their home; she rides there on a bicycle. She works six hours a day. 

She will use this loan to buy merchandise in order to increase the sales of her business. She will buy toys for boys and girls, among other things. The loan will improve her income, since Christmas time is when she sells the most. She wants to take this opportunity to increase her stock so as to meet the demand for her products.   

She wishes to build her own business in her own place. Her dream is to become a great business owner and to grow in different businesses so that she can help others and support her parents who have helped her so much. In the future she would like to continue her studies and complete a university degree. She will use her profits to buy more inputs so that she can expand her business and if possible install another stall in the neighborhood in order to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy toys for boys and girls, as well as other products that could increase her sales

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 24 years old from Kiambariki in Nyandarua. He is married and together with his wife they have a child who is two years old.

Simon has been farming for many years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on his farm.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. Apart from the dumpling-selling business, she operates a food kiosk. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil for resale. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, aged 38, is divorced with five children aged 19, 17, 15, 13, and 11 respectively and she pays school fees for all the four-school going children. She has a wholesale and retail shop in Kagadi town. The business was started in order to earn income to sustain the family.

Jane has approached UGAFODE for another loan of UGX 2,000,000. She wants to use the money to restock the business now that the festive season is approaching, she hope to make more profit, that will be used to repay the loan.

Jane faces challenges like competition and inflation and her additional income is from agriculture which is also unreliable. She thanks Ugafode for partnering with her to realise her dreams.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items like soap, sugar, salt and flour.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru: Улугбек обычный водитель, проживающий в районе Вахш. Ему 26 лет. Он женат и имеет сына. Улугбек живет в одном доме с женой, сыном, матерью и младшей сестрой. Его жена швея, сам Улугбек занимается предоставлением услуги такси в течение двух лет. У Улугбека есть племянник - сын его старшей сестры, которого зовут Абдугафор. Абдугафор в этом году поступил в Государственный Университет города Кургантюбе, в факультет "Финансовый менеджмент". Однако его семья сейчас не в финансовом состоянии, чтобы заплатить за его годовой контракт обучения в университете. Улугбек видит трудное положение семьи его сестры и очень хочет им помочь. Единственный выход из этого положения он видит в получении кредита. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом и просит поддержки. Он обещает выплачивать кредит в срок за счет своей деятельности.
texts.en:
Ulugbek is a regular taxi driver who lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 26 years old. He is married and has a son. Ulugbek lives in the same house as his wife, son, mother and youngest sister. His wife is a seamstress, and Ulugbek himself has offered a taxi service for a period of two years.

Ulugbek has a nephew, the son of his oldest sister, named Abdugafor. Abdugafor entered the State University of the city of Kurgantyube this year, in the faculty of "Financial management". His family is however currently not in a financial situation where they can pay for his yearly fee for education at the university. Ulugbek saw his sister's difficult family situation and would very much like to help them. He thinks the only way out of this situation is to receive a loan. With this aim he applied for a loan and requested help. He promises to pay back the loan on time, due to his business.

loans.use: to pay for his nephew's first year of education at the university

loans.name: Carlos Exequiel

texts.es:
Carlos, solicita capital para comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas y repuestos para celulares. Con esto tendrá lo necesario para preparar la tierra y equipar su negocio de reparación de celulares, generando más ganancias para cancelar sus deudas. 
Con el préstamo anterior el mejoro su economía, mejoro su negocio, le dio mejor atención a sus clientes,  su familia se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
Carlos is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, herbicides, insecticides, and mobile phone parts. This will allow him to work the land and to stock his mobile phone repair business, thus generating a higher profit so that he can pay back his loans.

With the previous loan he improved his economy and his business and served his clients better. His family is very healthy.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, insecticides, and mobile phone parts

loans.name: Union Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “UNION PROGRESO” está conformada por 10 mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras quienes día a día trabajan para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Carole tiene 32 años es conviviente con 01 educando y uno en espera el cual no le a impedido continuar con su negocio de venta de gaseosas golosinas y ropa. Es de esta manera que apoya a su esposo con la educación de su hijos y los gastos de su hogar. Su mayor deseo es terminar la fachada de su casa.  El préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de mas gaseosas y golosinas. el grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Carole es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: The communal bank "Union Progreso" is made up of 10 hard-working and enterprising women who work every day to give their families a better quality of life. Carole is 32 years old and in a civil union. She has one child and another one on the way; however, this does not prevent her from continuing her business selling soft drinks, sweets, and clothes. In this way she supports her husband in raising the children and covering the household expenses. Her greatest wish is to finish the façade of their house. She has used the loan to buy more soft drinks and sweets. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan that they have been offered. Carole is the first one from the left.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and sweets

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор спокойная и толерантная женщина. Она родилась в 1985 года. Гулбахор одна воспитывает 2 детей. Ее муж бросил ее и ее детей и женился на другой женщине. Гулбахор живет вместе со своими родителями и братьями. Она опытная портниха. Гулбахор научилась шитью женской одежды у своей сестры. Гулбахор предоставляет свои услуги дома. Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Гулбахор и его семья живут бедно, так как Гулбахор имеет маленький доход, а его брат не имеет постоянное место работы. Его брат хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию и найти там работу. Однако он не имеет денег для покупки авиабилета. Он попросил Гулбахора помочь ему. Гулбахор запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки авиабилета. Она ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет брату Гулбахора найти работу и таким образом улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is a calm and tolerant woman. She was born in 1985. Gulbahor raises two children by herself. Her husband left her and the children and married another woman. Gulbahor lives together with her parents and brothers. She is an experienced seamstress. Gulbahor learnt to sew women's clothing from her sisters. She offers her services from her home. She has returning clients. 

Gulbahor and her family lives in poverty, as Gulbahor has a small income and her brother does not have a permanent job. Her brother would like to go to the Russian Federation and find work there. However, he does not have money for purchasing a plane ticket. He asked Gulbahor to help him. Gulbahor requests a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni to purchase a plane ticket. She awaits your kindness. This loan will help Gulbahor's brother to find work and this way improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy plane ticket for her brother to fly to Russia to find work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabrics for the new season

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат после трагической смерти своего мужа, осталась без кормильца с 2 детьми. Ей очень трудно обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами, так как она имеет маленькую зарплату. Саодат более 3 лет работает в государственном учреждении. Она работает в отделе кадров. Саодат честная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она качественно и своевременно выполняет свою функцию. Саодат и ее дети живут в тяжелых условиях жилья. Она срочно должна отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом не отвечает стандартам жилья. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как краски, цемент и.т. для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
After her husband's tragic death, Saodat was left alone with 2 children and no one to provide for them. Saodat's small salary makes it very difficult for her to take care of her children. For more than 3 years, she has worked in the personnel department of a government office. She is honest and hard-working, and performs her duties diligently and punctually.

Saodat and her children live in poor conditions. She must promptly repair their home and bring it up to minimum living standards. She is requesting a loan of 1500 somoni to purchase building materials such as paint, cement etc. to carry out the repairs. Saodat is counting on you kindness and compassion.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as paint and cement for repairing her house

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru: Уулкан 57 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей.  У Уулкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Уулкан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 35 лет назад, с покупки скота на 500 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Уулкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 7 овец. Ежемесячный доход Уулкан составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Уулкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров с дальнейшим откормом и перепродажей. Доходы от кредита Уулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на завершение строительства нового недостроенного дома.
texts.en:
Uulkan is 57 years old and married. She and her husband are raising 4 children. Uulkan has secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Uulkan farms and raises livestock, having started 35 years ago by purchasing 500 som (KGS) worth of livestock. Thanks to her hard work, Uulkan's farms currently includes 2 dairy cows and 7 sheep, while her monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her business, Uulkan has turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 90,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows for fattening and resale.
