She plans to invest her profits from the loan into further expansion of her herd, and also hopes to save enough money to complete construction of her family's unfinished new house.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Mariama from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children.  For the past 20 years, Mariama has run her business of selling palm oil, cassava bread, and fried fish from her house. She began her business because she generates her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00 AM until 7:00 PM, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Mariama plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase footwear from to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Habiba Group

texts.en:
Habiba group consists of four women from Aden, Yemen.  Haiam is a 45-year-old married woman with children. She is illiterate and lives with her husband and children in a poor area in Aden. They are one of the low-income households in Aden. They suffer from bad living conditions. 

Haiam has a business selling women's clothes. She says that she started her business by buying clothes from the first loan and then she was able to sell them to customers around her area. She realized that her business was profitable and she set out to invest more in it. Now, she is applying for a loan of YER 80,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy additional women's clothes for her business. She hopes to have a clothing shop to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional women's clothes for her business.

loans.name: Maku

texts.en:
Maku is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school and the rest of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over six years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es nuevo y está trabajando para poder mejorar la vida de sus miembros, son todas mujeres muy luchadoras y que tienen ganas de salir adelante, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, y están haciendo la encuesta para conocer la situación de cada una.
La Sra.  Nidia, quien es una persona que está poniendo mucho empeño por poder ayudar a su familia, ella se dedica a vender ropas de variadas clases y con ello está tratando de obtener un mejor ingreso y seguir ayudando a su familia.
Con su crédito quiere comprar remeras, jeans y lencería para su reventa. A parte de las capacitaciones correspondientes y de los seguimientos también han hecho un plan de negocio así para que puedan tener un mejor control de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
This group is new, and it is working to improve the lives of its members. All of them are women who are very determined, with a great desire to get ahead. They are participating in the poverty elimination program, and they are taking the survey so that the situation of each one of them will be known. 

Nidia is a person who is putting in great efforts so that she can help her family. She works selling clothing of various kinds, and in this way she is trying to obtain a better income and continue helping her family. 

With her loan, she wants to buy t-shirts, jeans and underwear to resell. Through the accompanying training and the follow-up activities, she has also prepared a business plan, so that she can have better control over her earnings.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Zhumagul

texts.ru: Жумагул 37 лет. Она развелась с мужем и взяла на себя воспитания своего единственного ребенка, которому 10 лет. Она имеет высшее образование. Жумагул более 7 лет работает в милиции. Она руководитель отдела. Жумагул очень любит свою профессию и очень рада, что выбрала эту профессию. Она живет, счастлива со своим ребенком и старается дать ему все самое лучшее и хорошее образование. Жумагул планирует отремонтировать свой дом, так как она живет в плохое условие. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, краски и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Zhumagul is 37 years old. She divorced her husband and took on the responsibility of single-handedly raising their only child, who is 10 years of age. Zhumagul has post-secondary education. For over 7 years, she has worked in police and is currently the head of a department. Zhumagul loves her work and is glad to have chosen this profession. She lives happily with her son and tries to provide him with the best of everything, as well as with quality education.

Zhumagul is planning to repair her home since the living conditions there are poor. She is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni to purchase building materials such as cement, paint etc. She is counting on your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and paint for repairing her house

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 22-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo, an eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with one child who is three years old.  She began this business because she got married at an early age, so she has to strive for her living.

Kadiatu runs a cookery business at home; she sells cooked food. She has been running this business since 2009. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Kadiatu says that the main challenges to her business is the cost of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Kadiatu has requested a loan to buy more cooking items like rice, onions, and cooking seasonings. 

The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her child, and to increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, onions and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 43 years old from Nyandarua South and is married. They have five children who are between 23 and 2 years old.

Daniel has been farming for past four years. He has applied for his third loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy animal feed for his dairy. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan. 

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and from Murungani in Nyandarua; she is married, and together with her husband, they have two children who are  22  and 20 years old. 

Mary has been farming for the past 23 years. She has applied for her third loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy farm inputs like fertilizer, and also to pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes to see her farm expand in the near future, and also give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
María de 48 años, no estudio y esta soltera se separó de su compañero de vida desde hace 12 años,  tuvieron 3 hijos 2 de ellos son hogares aparte, en casa de ella, viven 2 personas 1 hija de ella y un nieto. 

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 23 años de dedicarse a esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres desde muy pequeña, le enseñaron a cultivar el maíz, el frijol, las hortalizas, las verduras. Cuando estaba acompañada, ella colaboraba con su esposo en el cultivo. 

Desde que se separó,  igual le ha tocado esforzarse para seguir cultivando la agricultura, pues no tiene otra forma de ayudar a su familia. Aunque ella tiene otra forma de generar un pequeño ingreso a su casa y es por la venta de dulces de coco,   hace 3 veces por semana para salir a vender al cantón donde vive.

Su lugar de trabajo le queda a 3 kilómetros de distancia, la cual recorre  en carro, para llegar hasta ahí paga transporte para llevar los insumos. Y su horario de trabajo son 5 horas al día.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar  3 sacos  de abono para fertilizar el maíz, pesticidas  y para fertilizar el frijol y maicillo que ya es  el tiempo propicio para hacerlo.

El préstamo mejorara de gran manera la producción agrícola,  porque lo fertilizara a tiempo la necesidad a satisfacer  será la de abonar a tiempo su cultivo de ella.
   

Su sueño es poder cultivar más cerca de su casa,  porque actualmente le queda demasiado lejos el trabajo y sueño un día tener su propio puesto de venta de granos básicos para ayudar a su gente que no tiene.  Para su familia, que logren sus metas con trabajo y esfuerzo. La ganancia la utilizara para reforzar el trabajo que tiene  de venta de dulces de coco.
texts.en:
María is 48, has no education, and is single, having separated from her husband twelve years ago. The couple has three children, two who of whom live on their own. María lives with one of her daughters and a grandson. 

María has run a small farm for 23 years. Her parents taught her to grown corn, beans, and a variety of vegetables when she was very young. She and her husband ran the farm together before they split up.   

The farm was the only way for María to support her family after her marriage ended, so she dedicated herself to managing it on her own. The farm is three kilometers from her home and she hires a car to take her there and carry supplies. María usually spends five hours a day working at the farm. She also has a small business preparing and selling coconut candies that provides a small income to supplement the farm. María travels around the canton three days a week selling the candy. 

María is applying for a loan to purchase pesticides and three bags of manure for her corn, bean, and sorghum crops. At this point in the season, these crops require fertilizer and pesticides. 

The supplies that María will purchase with this loan will boost her harvest significantly. She will be able to apply the fertilizer and pesticides at just the right time.  

María's goal is to be able to work a plot closer to her home, as the land she works now is too far away. She will also invest part of her income from the farm to invest in her coconut candy business. She also hopes one day to be able to sell staple grains in order to help support her family. She hopes that her children can strive and work to meet their goals.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and three bags of manure for her corn, bean, and sorghum crops. At this point in the season, these crops require fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Javier Beltran

texts.es:
Javier vive en la ciudad de jayanca, para poder tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente, Javier cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo amable con los clientes.
Javier está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá realizar un mantenimiento y reparación general de su vehículo, así podrá trabajar con mayor seguridad para el y sus clientes y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una  empresa de transporte”.
texts.en:
Javier lives in the city of Jayanca. In order to have income to be able to get ahead, he works as a motorcycle taxi driver. He works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 15 customers a day. Javier thinks that his work is going well for him because he is very responsible and above all very friendly to his customers.  

Javier is grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have offered he will be able to do some general maintenance and repair on his vehicle. This way, he will be able to work with more safety for him and his customers and he will keep fighting to make his biggest dream come true: having his own transportation business.

loans.use: to do maintenance and repair on his vehicle.

loans.name: Tamarisco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tamarisco  está en su 1er ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están formando parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una ha hecho la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una.
Una de ellas es Patricia, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir, con ingresos un poco bajos, pero ella, a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo quiere mejorar  su situación de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas  y con su crédito quiere comprar jeans, blusas, y lencerías varias y con ello abaratar los costos para obtener mejor ganancia.  A parte de las capacitaciones correspondientes y de los seguimientos también hemos hecho un presupuesto personal así para que puedan tener un mejor control de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The Tamarisco group is in the first loan cycle of the women's committee program. The group is taking part in the poverty elimination program, in which each member completes a detailed survey about her situation. 

Patricia is one member of Tamarisco group. Her survey result ranked her in level one, meaning that her income is on the low side. In spite of the poverty she faces, Patricia wants to achieve a better quality of life through hard work and effort. She sells clothing and plans to purchase jeans, blouses, and a variety of lingerie with this loan. Patricia hopes to reduce her costs and thus boost her income. We have provided training and follow-up to help the group members and also prepared a personal budget so that they can better track their income.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, blouses, and a variety of lingerie

loans.name: Quiere Al Niño Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Quiere Al Niño” está conformada por 07  socias activas que buscan mejorar cada día. Este es el caso de Dionisia que cumple el cargo de tesorera. Ella se dedica al alquiler  de cabinas de internet, poco a poco ha mejorado su negocio, pues también ahora ofrece servicios de fotocopias.  Con el crédito que solicitó podrá darles mantenimiento a sus computadoras. El sueño de Dionisia es de seguir trabajando y que su negocio siga creciendo.  Dionisia de 57 años, casada con 05 hijos independientes. El grupo “Quiere Al Niño” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Dionisia se encuentra en la parte posterior, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa color ploma.
texts.en:
The Quiere Al Niño community bank has seven active members who look for improvement every day.  

This is the case for Dionisia, who is the group's treasurer.  She works renting internet stations.  Little by little she has improved her business, and also now offers photocopying services.  With the the loan she is requesting, she will be able to perform maintenance on her computers.  Dionisia's dream is to continue working and for her business to continue growing.  Dionisia is 57 years old, married, and has five adult children.  

The Quiere Al Niño group thanks the people who are making this loan possible.  Dionisia is located in the back row.  She is the first on the left side, dressed in a grey sweater.

loans.use: to maintain computers.

loans.name: Karla Lisseth

texts.es: Karla de 26 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 6 años y de 2 años de edad. Karla es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable.  Desde hace dos años logro establecer un pequeño cafetín en cual ofrece variedad de golosinas, pan dulce, café, etc. De esta forma se gana la vida y logra llevar el sustento a su hogar.  Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su casa la cual requiere algunas mejoras. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de su casa ya que se encuentra dañado. Con el crédito comprará lámina galvanizada y madera. Espera poder contar con este apoyo lo antes posible.
texts.en: Karla is 26 years old. She lives in a home she owns with her life's companion and their two children, aged 6 and 2. Karla is a very hardworking and responsible woman. Two years ago, she was able to open a small cafe where she offers a variety of snacks, sweet bread, coffee, etc. This is how she earns her living and she is able to support her home. With a lot of hard work, she has been able to build her house which needs some improvements. She is asking for this loan from FUSAI  to invest in repairing the roof on her house because it is damaged. With the loan, she will be buy galvanized sheeting and wood. She hopes to have this support as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to repair the roof.

loans.name: Jhonny Luis

texts.es: Jhonny es un joven de 22 años que  hace 08 meses comenzó a estudiar la carrera de Mantenimiento y maquinaria pesada en un instituto de prestigio en la cual le va bien.  Actualmente vive con sus tíos, pues ellos son los que lo apoyan. También labora en una ferrería, esto le genera ingresos para poder cubrir con gran parte de los gastos de sus estudios. El crédito que solicitó lo invertirá en la compra de una laptop pues esto le facilitara realizar sus  trabajos de la universidad. Terminar la carrera y ser un profesional competitivo es su meta. Jhonny agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en: Jhonny is a 22 year old man. Eight months ago he started studying maintenance and heavy machinery at a prestigious institution and it is going well for him. Right now he lives with his aunt and uncle, because they are the ones who support him. He also works in a hardware store. This generates income  to be able to cover a large part of his education expenses. The loan he has asked for will be invested in buying a laptop because this will make his college work easier. Finishing his major and becoming a competitive professional are his goals. Jhonny is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 37 years old and from Bara Inya.  He is married, and he and his wife have five children, between 14 years and 3 months old.

John is a farmer, and he has farmed for many years. He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy seedlings and fertilizer to use in his farm.

He hopes to expand his farm in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertlizer

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 34 años, tiene cuarto grado de educación, está a acompañado desde hace 11 años su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar y también un trabajo de medio tiempo vendiendo frutas y verduras dentro de la colonia donde viven, tienen 3 hijos que estudian y aún viven con en casa.  

Él es cobrador de buses desde hace 4 años, este trabajo lo adquirió porque la agricultura no le era suficiente para mantener a sus hijos y esposa, por ese motivo decidió dedicarse a esta labor. También, se dedica al comercio pues todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano, para salir a vender pan dulce, francés a toda la colonia, el horario de esta labor es de 5 de la mañana a 7.30 a.m. a las 8.30 a.m. tiene que estar presente en la ruta donde trabaja y su horario de trabajo es de 6 horas diarias.

El préstamo será invertido en la vivienda, comprara adobe,  teja, y madera, para hacer su propia casa ya que actualmente vive con su familia. El préstamo mejorara su vida, porque tendrá donde vivir en lo propio, esto vendrá a mejorar la convivencia con su familia porque estarán en lo propio.

Sus sueños son ver a su familia superarse, a través del trabajo que todos como familia puedan hacer  y sueña con ver a sus hijos estudiar, para que un día sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Juan  is 34 years old, has the fourth grade and has been in a relationship for 11 years. His partner is dedicated to household chores and she also works part time selling fruit and greens in the settlement where they live. They have 3 children who go to school and still live at home.

He has been a fare-taker on buses for the last 4 years, a job he got because agriculture wasn't enough to support his children and his partner, so he decided to change to this job for that reason. He also has a business as every morning he gets up very early to go out and sell sweet bread and French bread to the entire settlement; he does this from 5 in the morning until 7.30 a.m. At 8.30 a.m. he has to be on the bus route where he works and his working hours consist of 6 hours a day.

This loan will be used on his house; he will buy sun-dried bricks, roof tiles and wood to build his own home seeing as he currently lives with his family. The loan will improve his life as he will have somewhere of his own to live which will improve the relationship with his family as they will be in their own place.

He dreams of seeing his family succeed through work that they can do as a family and of seeing his children study so that one day they can be professionals.

loans.use: buy sun-dried bricks, roof tiles and wood to build his own home seeing as he currently lives with his extended family

loans.name: Didin

texts.en:
Didin runs a small stall selling phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. Didin lives in Serang – a semi urban area three hours from Jakarta. Didin is married.

Didin began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. He feels really excited about expanding his business. Last month, he made around $20 to $30 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, he took out a loan from Kiva for getting a printer to support his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to purchase a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo  Kuña Aty está en su 1° ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 10 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos bajos, pero están luchando por mejorar y crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nazaria, quien se dedica a la venta de leche, comenta que día a día empieza su jornada de trabajo a muy tempranas horas, ya que quiere hacer llegar su producto a las casas de sus clientes para la hora del desayuno. Comenta que gracias a su trabajo está saliendo adelante, y también la ayuda mucho las capacitaciones que está recibiendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche para la venta, y así poder seguir esforzándose por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty group is in their first cycle with the women's committee.  They all work and help each other succeed.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey.  Ten members are below the poverty line, which means they have low incomes but they are fighting to improve and grow.  

One of the group members is Nazaria, who works selling milk.  She says that she starts her work day very early since she wants to get her product to her customers' houses in time for breakfast.  She says that thanks to her work she is moving forward and the trainings she is receiving are helping her a lot.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of milk to sell so that she can continue making an effort to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase milk to sell.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is 30 years old, and he lives in Gaza.  He sells various kinds of foodstuffs, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many others in his grocery store.  He opened it before one year ago.

Hani is requesting this youth loan of USD 1,500 to purchase a display refrigerator and more goods to sell. He is ready working hard achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

His dream is enlarge  his business in the future.  Hani is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a display refrigerator and more goods for his grocery

loans.name: Jacqueline Emperatriz

texts.es: Jacqueline de 25 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a esposo y  sus hijas de 6 años y de 1 año de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante desde hace 2 años. Gracias a su carisma y responsabilidad ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas que cada día le demandan más. Con el fin de brindar mejores condiciones habitacionales a su  familia, ha decidido solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento y arena para repellar las paredes de su casa y así protegerlas de futuros deterioros a causa de las lluvias.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 25 years old and lives in a house she owns with her husband and her daughters who are 6 and 1 years old.

She has had a mobile business selling clothes for the last two years. Thanks to her charisma and responsibility she has managed to gain the trust of many people who demand more products from her every day. 

In order to improve her family's living conditions, she has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying cement and sand to plaster the walls of her house and therefore protect them from future rain damage.

loans.use: buy cement and sand to plaster the walls of her house

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman is a 20-year-old single lady from Gaza city. She lives with her family in a very simple house in the city. 

Nariman is a student in a local university where she studies International Secretariat. She is in her second year. Nariman's father is an employee and he would like to help his daughter in her study by buying a new laptop for her.

Nariman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her study. By taking this loan, Nariman will be able to write her homework and reports. This will help her to finish her study and take a BA degree then find a good job in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a single mother of two chidren, aged 7 and 14.  She owns a restaurant and bar that she started in 2008 in order to support her family as single mother.

She has approached UGAFODE for a loan of UGX 500,00 to buy a fridge to be used in h restaurant and bar to attract more customers.  She will then be able to serve her customers fresh and cold drinks and also preserve her food well. 

She promises to repay her loan in six months, using sales from her restaurant business.  Her major challenges include competition from well-established restaurants and having no additional income.

She dreams of seeing both her children complete formal education and live happily.

loans.use: To buy a fridge for her restaurant and bar

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana de 34 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo  e hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace dos años. Posee muchos clientes ya que por su carisma y amabilidad muchas personas la prefieren. Ana siempre está buscando las formas de dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso del corredor de su casa ya que en la actualidad es de tierra. De esta forma desea dar condiciones más higiénicas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old and lives in a house she owns together with the husband and children.  She has worked selling clothing for two years.  She has many customers since many people prefer her because of her charisma and kindness.  

Ana is always looking for ways to give her children better living conditions, so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor in the hallway of her home, since it is currently made of dirt.  She hopes this will give her children healthier living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor in the hallway of her home.

loans.name: Isatu        B

texts.en:
Meet Isatu. She is in her late 40s and is from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has three children. 

She began her business because she wants to be self dependent and educate her children. For the past 13 years, Isatu has run her general stock business.  She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, juice and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Isatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, juice and pure water.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame, a divorced mother of three children, two of whom attend school while one is yet too young, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past two years, Dzame has operated a food kiosk, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Price fluctuation is her major challenge, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this Kshs 10,000 loan, Dzame wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale.

loans.name: José Edwin

texts.es:
José de 28 años, tiene sexto grado de educación,  está acompañado su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar y él se dedica  a la ganadería y en casa viven 5 personas sus padres y 2 hermanos más, los cuales se dedican a la agricultura. De José dependen su esposa de él y su hijo de 4 años nada más.

José se dedica a la ganadería, comprando ganado lo engorda y luego lo vende  después de un tiempo. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 9 años, este negocio se lo enseño el padre de él. Decidió dedicarse a eso, porque no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia, también trabaja en la agricultura.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar dos vaquillas, esto vendrá ayudar a través de la producción de leche, a mejorar la dieta alimenticia de su familia y aprovechar los residuos de la cosecha agrícola.

Su sueño para su familia, es que sus hijos estudien y saquen un estudio que les permita vivir dignamente, además, sueño en comercializar productos lácteos dentro de su comunidad y teniendo la oportunidad de tener mejores ingresos, y ayudar a su familia tengan una vida digna.
texts.en:
Jose is 28 years old, married, and has a sixth grade education. He works with livestock, and his wife is a homemaker. Jose lives with his parents and two of his siblings, who work in agriculture. He says that his wife and son, age 4, are dependent on him. 

Jose has worked with livestock for nine years, raising and fattening the animals he buys to later sell them. Jose learned the work from his father, and he says that he decided to work in this area because he could not find another way to support his family. He also works in agriculture. 

Jose is requesting this loan to buy two heifers. He says that the heifers will let him put the leftover harvest to good use, and that the milk they produce will improve his family’s diet. 

Jose says that his dream is to see his children study and choose a field that will let them have a good life. He also dreams of selling dairy products in his community in order to improve his income and help his family to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 47 years old and married to Stephen, is a mother of three children. She sells fish and ground nuts in Zimaman on the outskirts of Kiambu town.  In this business for 12 years, she has a monthly income of 25,650 shillings. 

This will be Elizabeth's third loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire amount to purchase more fish and ground nuts for resale. In future she wants to be a prosperous business woman.

loans.use: to purchase fish and ground nuts for resale

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 21 años de edad, el cual trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, este trabajo es su única fuente de ingresos para poder solventar sus estudios de mecánica automotriz.

Juan esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita  como tarrajear las paredes, poner pisos entre otros, de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener otra mototaxi y acabar sus estudios”.
texts.en:
Juan is a 21-year old young man who works as a mototaxi driver. This is his only income source to cover the tuition for his automotive mechanics studies. 

Juan is grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, he has been able to make improvements to his house, such as covering walls or building an extra floor. This has helped him to improve his quality of life and he will keep fighting to make his big dream come true: to have another mototaxi and to finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nihad

texts.en:
Nihad, a 37-year-old married man from Gaza city, lives with his wife, two sons and one daughter. The sole income provider for his family, Nihad is an employee in the public sector and earns a low wage. 

Nihad needs an appendectomy and so has taken a USD loan from FATEN to help pay the costs of the surgery. The operation will help him  to get back to work and live a normal life.

loans.use: to pay the costs of an urgent surgery for him.

loans.name: Francis Misael

texts.es: Francis de 24 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad. Desde hace 7 años  se dedica a la venta de cereales tales como maíz, arroz y frijoles. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y logra dar a su familia lo necesario. Su deseo es mejorar las paredes y el piso de su humilde casa. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en compra de arena, cemento y  láminas  para encementar el piso y reparar las paredes de su vivienda. Expresa tener la capacidad para pagar las cuotas que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Francis is a 24-year old man who lives with his life partner and their 4-year old daughter. For 7 years he has been selling cereals, such as corn, rice and beans, which is how he supports his household and gives his family everything it needs. 

He would like to improve the walls and floor of his modest house, which is why he is requesting a loan to FUSAI. He plans to buy sand, cement and layers to put cement on the floor and to repair the walls. He has expressed that he has the capacity to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and layers to put cement on the floor and to repair the walls of his house.

loans.name: Bintiomari

texts.en:
Bintiomari operates an open-air food stall, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the seasonality in her place of business. 

Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of 30,000 KES. She wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat to use in food preparation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josephat is a 33-year-old man, married to Loise. He is a father of two children.

He is a taxi operator and has been in this business for seven years. He gets a monthly income of 30,000 shillings.

This will be Josephat's second loan with KADET Ltd. He intends to use the loan to service his car and buy new tyres for the taxi. His future hope is to have a better life with his children.

loans.use: to buy new tyres for the taxi.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin sells household goods in Kangundo town and has been in the business for the last 13 years. He is 35 years old, married, and together with his spouse, he has been blessed with two children. 

This will be his second loan term and he plans to use the loan to buy more household goods for selling. These include water basins and buckets, plates and cooking pans. He anticipates to make more income with which he will use to start a business for his wife. He paid his previous loan successfully. 

In the future, Martin hopes to grow his business and have a big retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more household goods, such as water basins, buckets, plates and cooking pans for selling.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and sells fruits and vegetables in Kangundo town. She is married to Kennedy and they have been blessed with three children. Kennedy also provides additional income. She has been in this business for the last 10 years.

She plans to use this loan to buy more bananas, passion fruits and cabbages to sell. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to open a grocery store.

This is her second loan term and she hopes to educate all her children in future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kupha

texts.en:
Kupha is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a kiosk shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, cooking  oil.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children. She started business to take care of her family. 

Kadiatu runs a food stand business at home. She sells rice, onions and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business since 2007. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Kadiatu says that the main challenges to her business are price, transportation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, onions and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, onions and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 48-year-old woman. She is married to John and they are blessed with three children. 

She runs a retail shop in Gatimu in the outskirts of Limuru. Jane also practices crop farming. Jane has been in the retail business for five years now and gets a monthly income of 6,200 Kenyan shillings.

This will be Jane's first loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc. to sell at her retail shop. Jane will plough back the profits received to expand her businesses and educate her children. In future, she wants to be a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, rice, etc

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 42 years old and married to Mathew. They have been blessed with 3 children. She does dairy farming and also plants cash crops in Kangundo town. Her spouse also gives additional income to support the family. Florence has been in the farming business for 6 years and it has been profitable.

She will be using this loan to buy farm supplies. These include dairy feeds, fertilizer and seeds for planting. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to improve the living standards of her family.

This is her 3rd loan term and she paid all her previous loans successfully. In the future Florence hopes to be financially stable and support her children.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Jaime es un hombre de 49 años de edad y reside en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos. Para él lo más importante es su querida familia y es por quien trabaja muy duro todos los días como empleado de una empresa cerca de su localidad. Además, ha adecuado una pequeña tienda en su residencia en donde vende variedad de especies, golosinas, etc. Desea mejorar el piso de su vivienda ya que como se puede apreciar  en la fotografía es de tierra. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava de tal forma que pueda encementar el piso de su casa lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Jaime is 49 years old and lives with his wife and children in their own home. He says that the most important thing in his life is his family, for whom he works very hard every day as an employee of a company in the area. In addition, Jaime has converted part of his home into a small store, where he sells a variety of snacks and other items.

Jaime is requesting this loan from Kiva and the field partner to buy cement, sand and gravel to install a concrete floor in his home. He says that he wants to improve the floor of his home as soon as possible, which as shown in the photo, is currently made of mud.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to install a concrete floor in his home

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander de 36 años de edad habita en casa propia junto con su esposa y su hijo quien ya es mayor de edad. Su principal fuente de ingresos es la venta de verduras (zanahorias, ayotes, cebollas, tomates, papas, etc.) la cual ofrece a muchos clientes de su localidad.  Su deseo es dar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento y arena para encementar el piso ya que en la actualidad es de tierra y desea dar condicionas más higiénicas a su familia. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poder mejorar el piso lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Alexander is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and their son who is already an adult, in the house that he owns.

He earns his income primarily from selling vegetables (carrots, squash, onions, tomatoes, potatoes, etc.) to many customers in the region. 

His desire is to give his family better housing conditions. In order to do so, he has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy cement and sand to lay down a cement floor. His home currently has an earthen floor, and he wants to provide his family with more hygienic conditions. 

He hopes to have the support to be able to improve the floor as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand to lay down a cement floor.

loans.name: Frederik

texts.en:
This is Frederik, an Egyptian man who is indeed poor, as you can tell from the picture. He is asking for your financial help to help him do some minor repair to his little family home. This will be his second loan.

Frederik is married and has two children in their early twenties with neither one being employed. The unemployment rate amongst youngsters in Albania is extremely high. Until the recent economic downturn in the neighboring countries, Greece and Italy, many young people found employment there.

Frederik works in two jobs, one as a reinforcing iron worker and the other one as a security guard in a deli factory in his city.

loans.use: to make minor repair to their family home

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia, 54, lives with her grown daughter in the village of Khoshatiani. Mzia runs small-scale agricultural business and breeds two milk cows. She produces dairy products for selling as wells as family consumption. She also has a nut garden and sells the harvest seasonally.

In order to generate monthly income, Mzia decided to start up a grocery store near her house, but she found she didn’t have enough money to do so.

Unfortunately, Mzia was unable to obtain a loan from existing financial institutions, as they required business experience and stable income as a precondition to a loan. But Mzia has now received her loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides start-up and re-startup loans with easy terms to the vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products. 

With a loan of 2,500 GEL, Mzia will purchase stock of basic groceries to start a store. She and her daughter will work as salespersons and serve the clients in a friendly way. Mzia is a very determined lady and hopes her project will be lucrative. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase stock of merchandise and start up a grocery store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old married man and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife who always helps her husband. Since 2009, Ali has been running a tailoring supply shop, which is the only source of income for his family. He purchases supplies from the central bazaar and sells them in the local market. 

Currently, he is in need of purchasing more supplies from the central bazaar to continue his shop, but due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. For that reason, he has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his tailoring supply shop, but will increase his net income and savings as well. He desires to provide quality education to his children. He is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is a 37-year-old woman. She is married to Harrison and is a mother of two children. She runs a boutique in Nairobi. Recently, she ventured into a fruits-selling business as a side business, and it is picking up slowly.  She has been in the clothes sales business for six years and she gets a monthly income of 25,000 shillings.
 
This will be Linah's third loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy clothes for selling. In future, she wants to be a prosperous businesswoman so that she can improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for selling.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, a 25-year-old single mother of one, supports both her child and her mother. Agnes hawks green tea leaves in Nandi county and also keeps indigenous dairy cows whose milk she sells for additional income. In business for three years, she earns an average of kshs 10,000 a month.

Agnes intends to use her first loan of Kshs. 80,000 from Kadet Ltd to purchase sacks of green tea leaves from local farmers to resell to a tea factory for a profit. She will use the profits to expand her business and provide for her family as well as save some for the education of her child.

Agnes' dream is to succeed in life and give the best support possible to her family members.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaves

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 39 years old and is married. He runs a metal workshop (welding and fitting) business and has been in the business for 12 years now. His wife, who is a nursery school teacher, also provides income. They have been blessed with one child who is 4 years old.   

He plans to use the loan to purchase more equipment, like bench and grinding machines. He plans to use the anticipated profits to buy a plot of land. This is his 2nd loan term and he paid his first loan successfully. 

He hopes to expand his business and be able to sell ready made items, mostly machines like charcoal briquette-making machines.

loans.use: To buy more equipment.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo in the Eastern area of Freetown. She is married with 6 children, with ages between 3 years and 18 years. During the past 15 years, Salamatu established her local food stuff business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Forever 1 Group

texts.en:
Milasan is the featured borrower of Forever 1 group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have been best friends since they came to work as housekeepers here in Lebanon to provide their family a better standard of living.

Milasan is a 40-year-old married mother of four children. She works as a housekeeper to provide her family a good living. Milasan's acquired loan will be sent to her family back in Philippines to pay for their needs.

She is the first lady from the far right side of the picture. As for the other group members,  Marites is the lady at the far left and Marita is at the center of the picture.

loans.use: To send money to her family in Philippines.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 52-year-old divorced Palestinian mother of seven children. She sacrificed her whole life, working hard to provide them with a good standard of living. Fatima has been working in the business of preserving foods (Mouneh) for twelve years, and it is her only source of income. Her business is located inside her house, because as a Palestinian refugee, she wasn't financially capable of opening a separate business. At the same time she had to stay next to her children to take good care of them while she is running her business.

Fatima is a hard worker with a very good reputation in the camp where she lives and works. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with raw materials in order to increase her production before the winter season. She will buy Sumac, Thyme, and olives.

This is Fatima's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Through her previous loans she was capable of increasing her business capital and responding better to her children's needs. She hopes that in the future she will be capable of diversifying her products and expanding her work zone.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with raw materials in order to increase her production before the winter season.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 26-year-old man from Nakuru, and he is not married yet. He has a barber shop, a business he has been running for the last 2 years, and to enable him to buy more shaving machines, he has applied for his first loan of Kshs 10,000 from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now is about Kshs 8,000 and he plans to use profits from his expanded business to start another income-generating project. He hopes to have a fulfilled future.

loans.use: To buy some additional shaving machines.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is from Nakuru and is 46 years old. She is married to Joseph who produces some additional income for the family, and they are blessed with four children, ages 23, 20, 17 and 13 years old.

She is a farmer who specializes mainly in dairy farming, and she also raises chickens, a business she has been running for the last 13 years. To enable her to buy feeds for her cows and chickens, she has applied for her first loan of Kshs 100,000 from Kadet Ltd.

From the sale of milk and eggs, she makes a monthly income of about Kshs 40,000. She intends to use profits realized from her expanded business to construct some rental houses for more income. She hopes for a fulfilled future.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Esther. She is friendly and works very hard to take care of her family. She lives at home with her mother, father and twin sister. She runs a Zoona mobile money transfer business in Chilanga, a town located 20 km away from the Zambian capital city of Lusaka.

Before running her own mobile money business, Esther worked as a cashier for a lending financial institution. She used her salary to take herself to school and obtained a certificate in Banking and Finance. Her experience helps her in the day-to-day running of her business. 

Esther says her community benefits from her business of mobile money transfers because they do not have to travel to the big city of Lusaka, as they used to in the past to access financial services. She is very pleased with the business because it allows her to have a minimum income at the end of the month to pay for rentals.

Esther is pleased to be connected to the Kiva lenders and have the opportunity to access working capital support. She explains that even though she has been running her business for three years now, it has not experienced a lot of growth. This is due to the fact the she does not have enough money in her business to serve customers who want to send and receive larger amounts of money. Currently, Esther is operating with a very low amount of capital reserves. This is not enough because mobile money is becoming more popular and the demand for the product has increased.

Esther is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can grow her business, by adding money to enable her to serve more customers. With increased working capital, Esther is confident she can earn additional profits, grow her business, and provide better for herself and family.

loans.use: to add more money to serve more customers who need to access financial services at her booth.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is married with three children, ages 3, 6 and 8. He pays tuition for two of them, using the income that he earns from the sale of produce. He sells locally-made gin to supplement his income. Having two businesses has helped him to get enough income to provide for his family.

George has now approached Ugafode for another loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy local gin that is a delicacy among the locals. Initially he took UGX 1,000,000 to buy produce; however, he says the demand for local gin is now high.

He has promised to pay back the loan after the sale of the gin. However, George faces challenges like seasonality and competition, especially when his income from produce is unreliable.

loans.use: To buy local gin.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 35 years old and is married. Together with his wife, he has two young children who are 2 and 1 year old.

James has a motorcycle business that he has been running for several years. He has applied for his third loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him to service his motorcycle. 

He hopes to own a fleet of vehicles in the near future.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam lives in Mariakani, Kenya. She is 26 years old, a wife and a mother of one. She is also a business lady and she runs her own cosmetics business that has been in operation for the last 6 months. She started the business from her personal savings with a contribution from her husband. 

She knew about Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy hair relaxers and hair oil for her business. She hopes that in the next five years she will grow the business into a company dealing with cosmetic solutions. She also wants to open other branches of the business and be able to run more businesses. The income she will raise will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers and hair oil.

loans.name: Mondayma

texts.en:
Mondayma lives in Paynesville, which is one of the more populated areas in Montserrado County. She is 37 years old and unmarried. She has two children who are 15 and 16 years old, and they are in school and live at home. 

Mondayma did not go to school, so she decided to keep herself busy with a business by selling butter and bread to improve her living conditions. She started this business with a little money from her fiancée ten years ago. She said that having fewer goods on her table is the only challenge she faces for now. 

She likes her business because it is profitable. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She said that she is proud of her business because it is the only means by which she can make money. Mondayma said that with the loan she is going to buy more butter and bread to resell. Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more butter and bread to resell.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 40-year-old single lady who has been employed in a clothes-selling shop since seven years ago. Her low monthly salary isn't enough income to cover her sudden unexpected needs. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua: to pay for her medical needs.

She hopes to move forward for a better future.

loans.use: To pay for her medical needs.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina de 49 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar desde hace mucho tiempo. Tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de antojitos típicos (yuca frita, pastelitos de carne, etc.) y así es como ha logrado salir adelante y llevar la economía a su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar arena y cemento para repellar pared y encementar el piso. Tiene la seguridad de que con su venta de antojitos logrará sacar las cuotas del crédito.
texts.en:
Cristina is 49 years old. She has lived in a house on her own property together with her family for a long time. For the past five years she has been selling traditional snacks like fried plantain, meat pies etc. This is how she has gotten ahead and raised the family's economy. 

With the goal of improving the condition of her house Cristina is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy sand and cement to plaster the walls and to cement in her floor. She is certain that with the sales of the snacks she will be able to meet the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to plaster the walls and cement in the floor.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en: Mgeni appreciates the previous loan which helped her to increase her stock. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more fruits to make juice and detergents for soap preparation. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to make juice and detergents for soap preparation.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 37 years old and married. They are blessed with two children, who are in school. She has a grocery business in Naivasha, which she has been running for three years. She makes an average income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings and has applied for a first loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable her to purchase stock such as bananas, potatoes, and tomatoes among others. She plans to boost her business and also pay school fees with the anticipated profit from her expanded business. In the near future, she hopes to be financially stable and also to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase stock such as bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Topi

texts.en:
Topi, a 38-year-old divorced mother of two children aged 13 and 18, has been a hairdresser since 1998 in order to meet her family's needs, which include her children's school fees. Topi's main challenge is the fact that bigger customers, for example those having parties, prefer bigger salons. She thus needs to improve hers.

Having been granted an initial loan of ugx 300,000= from Ugafode, Topi is requesting a new one for ugx.500, 000= in order to buy more salon items. Her  dream is to develop her business into a bigger one in order to meet customer demand in the town of Kagadi and the neighboring area.

loans.use: To buy salon items

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Trabajadoras está en el  ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas también forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde están poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra Nilda quien hizo su encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y trabaja por ir mejorando su trabajo y su situación de pobreza, y comenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, con la cual está mejorando sus ingresos y por medio de ello ayuda a su familia.
La Sra. Nilda Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos  en general, como ser verduras, carne, frutas, productos a granel y demás,  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Los niños que están en la fotografía son hijos de nuestros clientes. en la foto del grupo aparecen mas personas, ya que el grupo tiene mas miembros que en esta ocasión no retiran crédito pero que forman parte del comité.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Trabajadoras" is in its 7th loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program of Fundación Paraguaya.  They are also participating in the institution's poverty elimination program, putting in maximum effort to improve their poverty situation.

One of the members is Nilda.  She took the poverty elimination survey, and is working to improve her business and her financial situation.  She comments that she has a well-stocked store, with which she is increasing her income and helping her family.

Nilda is requesting this loan to buy general products such as vegetables, meat, fruit, and other bulk products.  This will help her to carry out her plans for her business, which will help her to increase her income.  The children in the photograph are the children of the members.  In the photo there are more people shown than are taking this loan, because there are some members who will not be taking a loan at this time, but they are part of the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruit, and other bulk products

loans.name: Esperanza  De Vida Con El Futuro Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Esperanza De Vida Con El Futuro” conformada por 08 socios responsables y unidos, la cual pasan a su 08 ciclo. El Sr. Guillermo de 56 años es viudo y tiene 04 hijos 02 de ellos aún dependientes. El se dedica a la venta de utensilios de cocina ambulatoriamente. Con su trabajo y esfuerzo a podido mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus 02 menores hijos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de ollas, tenedores y platos. El deseo de Guillermo es de instalar un local donde pueda exhibir sus productos. El grupo “Esperanza De Vida Con El Futuro” esta agradecidos con el apoyo brindado, ya que hace posible su progreso. Guillermo se encuentra de pie, es el primero del lado izquierdo y viste una camiseta color azul.
texts.en:
Meet the “Esperanza De Vida Con El Futuro” group. Composed of 8 members it is going into it's 8th cycle. 

Guillermo is 56 years old. He is a widower and has 4 children, two of them still dependent on him. He sells kitchen utensils door to door. Through his work and efforts he has been able to improve his house and support his two dependent children. 

Guillermo is requesting this loan to buy pots, forks and plates. His wish is to set up a place where he can display his wares. 

The “Esperanza De Vida Con El Futuro” group is grateful for the support offered them which makes it possible for them to progress. Guillermo is the first person on the left, wearing a blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy pots, forks and plates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase: galvanized corrugated metal, wood, and nails to repair the roof and walls of her home.

loans.name: Zolia Alejandra

texts.es:
Zoila es una joven de 21 años con muchas ganas de poder mejorar su calidad, sobre todo porque es madre de un pequeño de 3 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, con cuyos ingresos la ayudan mucho para poder sacar adelante a su hijo.

Zolia agradece el apoyo qu ele brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar mercadería para su bodega como atún, fideos, gaseosas, productos de bazar entre otros y así poder salir adelante y luchar ´por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Zolia is a young woman, 21 years old, who strongly wishes to improve the quality of her life. Above all, this is because she is the mother of a small child who is 3 years old. With much effort, she managed to begin her small business selling groceries, and that income greatly helps her to be able to bring her son out ahead.

Zolia is thankful for the support that the Kiva lenders provide since thanks to this she will be able to purchase merchandise for her small grocery store such as tuna, noodles, sodas, and stationery products, among others, and so be able to go on and fight to make her dream a reality: “To have her own home.”

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 21 years old and a single mother of two whom she supports. She is into the milk-trade business in Kericho town. This has been her income-generating business for the last five years. She gets an average monthly income of 150,000 KES [Kenyan shillings].

She has borrowed a loan of 100,000 KES, and she plans to use the amount borrowed to purchase more milk for resale and a small cooler to preserve the milk before she sells it. Her dream is to educate her children to a higher level of education. She also hopes to expand her business and purchase a milk-processing machine and a cooling plant.

loans.use: To purchase more milk for resale and a small cooler to preserve it.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a woman of forty-seven years. She is a widow and has four children, and she does horticultural farming in Limuru. She has been in the business for three years now and gets a monthly income of five thousand eight hundred shillings. 

This will be Mary’s third loan with KADET LTD, and she plans use the entire loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer, seedlings etc. In the future, she wants to be a prosperous business woman so that she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna, age 35, is from Samtredia district. She lives alone in her own house, and works as a salesperson at the optics store. She gets a monthly salary there; nearly $120.

Khatuna is a hard-working young woman with a great desire to get ahead. Her salary is not enough for saving and improving her standard of living. Khatuna has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing and linens at wholesale prices and start a sales business among her co-workers and community members. 

Since there are not many clothing stores in her district, Khatuna's business will have high demand. She will be very nice to her customers and will be able to get more profits. Khatuna will invest the profits in the same business, and increase the turnover gradually. This start up loan is a good chance for Khatuna to earn a stable income and improve her living conditions in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and linens for resale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a 68-year-old married lady. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and granddaughter in a small village within the Lanchkhuti district. Marina gets orders and makes plural cosmetics to sell. Her son is a physical worker and earns little income. The family lives in poverty as they have not enough income to cover everyday expenses. Marina decided to purchase cows and start a husbandry business. The start-up loan, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $3,500 to purchase cows. She will also build the shed for the cows with the credit received, so the family can  start their husbandry business. Marina and her daughter-in-law will produce dairy products to sell and increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase cows and build a shed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Trabajadoras  se encuentra en el 1er. Ciclo del programa de comité, tiene 19 integrantes actualmente, es un grupo que practican entre ellas la  solidaridad, ayuda mutua y responsabilidad, todas ellas son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora Basilica de 45 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas desde hace muchos años por la ciudad y con esta actividad pudo sacar adelante a su familia ya que la misma posee una clientela formada, ella agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder ir mejorando y luchando por el bien de su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, como ser jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás, y así seguir creciendo en su trabajo y también poder mejorar sus ingresos
texts.en:
Mujeres Trabajadoras is in its first cycle of the committee’s program. It has 19 members currently. It is a group that among its members practices solidarity, mutual help, and responsibility. All of them are very hard-working and tenacious.

One of the stories worthy of highlighting is that of Basilica, who is 45 years old. She has made a living selling clothes for many years throughout the city, and with this activity she was able to bring her family out ahead since she has a well-formed customer base. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue improving and fighting for the wellbeing of her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of a variety of items, such as jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants, and more, and so continue expanding her work and also be able to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing, such as jeans, t shirts, shirts, pants, and more.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Sarun is a hardworking and married woman with six children. She is 45 years old, and a farmer in Svay Rieng province. She owns and manages around two-hectare land, primarily growing and harvesting rice to sell. She has been doing farming for nearly 30 years. Through her hardships, she aims to uplift this family out of poverty and educate all her children at school.

Sarun would like to have enough energy for household and reduce monthly expenses by purchasing a set of solar home system for installing at her home. Due to inadequate funds, she has requested a loan in the amount of KHR 1,600,000 from Kiva through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, Sarun hopes to have clean energy to support her household appliances, such as light, TV and radio. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate than its general loan. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for installing at her home.

loans.name: Mang

texts.en:
Mang is a 60-year-old man and a responsible father of six children. He is involved in the agriculture businesses, and he raises pigs and farms rice. He has been in this business for years with some help from his children and wife. His wife, who shares the goal of developing their living standard and helping their children in their future education, contributes her income earned by weaving baskets to sell in local markets of the province. Recently their son, Raksmey aged 18 (pictured), graduated from high school and passed his exam with grade C. Raksmey wants to continue his chemistry studies at Royal University of Phnom Penh. He loves to study in this field and wants to become a high school chemistry teacher. 

At this time, Mang has applied for a loan to pay for the university tuition fees of his son. With this loan, he can now accommodate the expenses of his son. Raksmey, pictured here, will be furthering his education with the funds from this loan.  His father, who is not included in the picture, is applying for the loan from Kiva and will be responsible for principal repayments. He thanks lenders for distributing their funds in a program like Kiva via its partner HKL to push students to get better education.

loans.use: pay for the University tuition fees of his son.

loans.name: Taghareed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 28-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working in manufacturing and selling special perfumes since three years ago. In March 2013, she started her own business inside her house to take good care of her beloved baby, and at the same time, develop her newly established business gradually.

Taghreed is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise by adding special released essences that will help her develop her business in a well managed way.

Taghreed is well known in her region by her good reputation and the hard work she puts to support her husband in their living. She hopes that in the future, she'll be capable of opening a wider perfume shop outside her house.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise by adding special released essences to develop her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of vegetables and smoked fish.

loans.name: Geovanny Alexander

texts.es: Geovanny de 21 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su madre quien depende de él. Desde hace 5 años trabaja muy duro para llevar el sustento a su hogar y ayudar a su madre con los gastos de alimentación. Él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas. Gracias a su responsabilidad y carisma ha logrado hacer muchos clientes y cada día sus productos son más demandados. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, ladrillo y arena ya que desea construir una pila con baño y lavadero. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y poder hacer la construcción de la pila lo antes posible ya que es bien necesaria para reguardar el agua de uso diario.
texts.en:
Geovanny is 21 years old. He lives in his own home with his mother who is dependent on him. For the past five years he has been working hard making a living and helping his mother with the food expenses. He makes and sells hammocks. Thanks to his responsibility and charisma he has managed to gain lots of clients. Day by day his product is more in demand. 

Geovanny is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying cement, bricks and sand as he wants to construct a sink as soon as possible. It is a necessity for storing water for their everyday use.

loans.use: to buy cement, brick and sand to construct a sink complete with a water holding tank and a clothes washing station.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Steven is 35 years old and engaged to marry his partner, Kombe. He lives in a rented house with his older sister. His background is in mechanics but now Steven successfully runs a Zoona mobile money transfers business in Lusaka, Zambia.  

Steven began his business a year ago with limited start up capital. Through hard work he has doubled his capital but it is still not what is necessary to service all his customers' needs to transfer money. Steven cannot service anyone wanting to send or receive larger sums of money due to his limited funds. The reason for the loan is so Steven can increase his working capital in order to service more customers and earn additional profit. 
 
Steven loves running his business because it provides an easy way for people to transfer their money.  He uses some of the earnings from his shop to support his siblings and pay for utility bills.  He is very hopeful that once his loan comes in, he will earn more profits and be able to provide for his soon-to-be wife.

loans.use: To grow his mobile money business and serve more customers in need of financial services

loans.name: Kasaine

texts.en:
Kasaine is 57 years old, married to Jane, and together they are blessed with seven children who are in school.

He is in the farming business in Naivasha, which he has practiced for ten years. He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy fertilizer and seeds. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees for his children.

In the near future, he hopes to increase his farm output on a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en: Ramaz is a 65-year-old married man. He lives in a small village of Tskaltubo district with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and two granddaughters. His wife is a teacher at a local school and gets 300 GEL per month. Ramaz is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a cow and two calves, whose milk is used in making cheese products to sell. Ramaz decided to build a greenhouse and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $3200. With the received credit he will purchase building materials and will build a greenhouse, where he will sow cucumbers and tomatoes to sell. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is glad to be connected with supporters of BRAC Liberia. This has been a great helps for her and her children. She said that with this loan: "I will be able to pay my children's school fees and have some money at home". 

Betty is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville South. She is married with four children, ages between 6 and 22, who are attending school and living at home. Over the past 16 years, she has been selling charcoal by bag from a shop.

Betty has requested this loan to purchase more charcoal by bag to increase her sales even more. She points out low inventory as her challenge in business. She started this business by helping her mother in her shop. In the near future, she likes to have her own house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal by bag to increase her sales even more.

loans.name: Road To Success Group

texts.en:
