She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of various fragrances and continue with her sales and help her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of perfumes to sell

loans.name: Arshak

texts.en:
Arshak is a private entrepreneur from Gyumri city of Shirak region. He lives with his wife and two school-age daughters (8 and 10 years old). To be able to take care of his family's needs, Arshak runs a local store where he sells heating systems that are sent by his brother from Europe. He also provides different services related to installation of those systems. 

The assortment of items that Arshak sells is not very big and needs to be expanded in order for his small business to function productively. He needs a loan of $3000 USD to purchase new items to sell in the store. The loan will help him maintain and develop his small business further. Arshak and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and are thankful for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell in his store

loans.name: Kuña Aty El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Aty El Triunfo está en su ciclo número  4to. del programa de comité, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están poniendo su mayor esfuerzo por superar su pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Graciela, quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles variados, comenta que a su clientela le agrada mucho las comidas que hace, y es por eso que le está yendo muy bien. Ella es una persona muy hábil en lo que hace, y es gracias a eso que día a día mejora, también recibe capacitaciones de como poder mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos, harina, huevo y demás. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group "Kuña Aty El Triunfo" is in its 4th cycle of the committee's program. They form part of the program of poverty elimination, where all of them are putting forth their greatest effort to overcome their poverty. 

One of the members is Graciela, who works in the sale of a variety of groceries. She comments that her customers really like the food that she makes, and it is for that reason that it is going well for her. She is a person who is very skillful in what she does, and it is thanks to that, that day by day she gets better. She also receives trainings of how to be able to improve. 

She is asking for this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of supplies to be able to continue making food, including meat, vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs, and more. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving, since it will be very helpful for her.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs, and more.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 29 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She did attend school. She is married and has three children, whose ages are between 8 and 11. Her husband is a businessman, and her children attend school. Mamie has been involved in the apple business for the past two years. She enjoys her business, because she makes a lot of profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase five boxes of apples for her business. She plans to educate her children and build a house, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase five boxes of apples for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is a widow and has six children. Only three children attend school and live at home. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. For the past 20 years she has been running a table where she sells fish.  She sells fish six days a week from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m.  

She likes her business because of the customers that buy from her, and because she started this business with money given to her by her mother. She always uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her business table.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.  She thanks the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.en:
Albertine is 43 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is not married but lives with her boyfriend and has two children. She did not go to school due to financial problem. Her children are 6 and 8 years old and they are currently in school. Her partner is a seller of scratch cards. 

Albertine has had a business selling soft drinks for four years. Some days the business is good and other days it is very slow. She started this business by selling water and bread. Now she is proud to support herself and her children.  Albertine has requested a loan to purchase more soft drinks to resell. In the future she hopes to build a house. She wants to be in good health so she can pay back the money and keep supporting her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está empezando a trabajar, ya que está en su ciclo uno, están formando parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo para salir de la línea de pobreza. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero debe seguir trabajando y esforzándose. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa quiere mejorar  su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente. Ella vende comestibles, y es de esa forma humilde que está tratando de salir adelante y dar a su familia lo mejor.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende, y así seguir trabajando por mejorar su vida y su situación económica.
texts.en:
This group is starting to work, since it is in its first cycle. They are forming part of the program of poverty elimination, where every one of them puts forth their best effort in order to leave the poverty line.

One of the members is Rosa, who in her survey showed a level of poverty inside of level one. This is to say that she has very low income, but she should continue working and putting forth effort. Through effort and continuous work and the application of the vital behaviors of a successful woman, she wants to improve her situation of poverty, but she is equally conscious of the fact that this work and effort that she is making should be continuous and permanent. 

She sells food, and it is in this humble way that she is trying to move forward and give the best to her family. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies to be able to continue making the food that she sells, and in that way continue working to improve her life and economic situation.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food to sell.
